loans.name: Santa Barbara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTA BARBARA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, de la cual es tesorera la señora Carmen. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción, cultivo y servicio 

La señora Carmen,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de sembradío de verduras que  inicio desde niña con el apoyo de sus padres.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de semillas para cosechar que adquirirá de la ciudad de El Alto y los venderá posterior al cultivo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los préstamos y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Santa Barbara village bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación regional hub. The group has eight members, and Carmen is the chair of its board of directors. The members' business are quite varied, and included retail, manufacturing, service, and agricultural enterprises.
Carmen says that this is the first time she's worked with Pro Mujer. Currently, she has a business growing vegetables, which she started with her parents' help when she was young.
The loan she's requesting now is to purchase seeds for her crops, which she will obtain in the city of El Alto. Selling her harvests allows her to bring in an income to support her family, since she is married and has two children.
When we ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the loans and the ability to save.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for her crops.

loans.name: Los Emprendedores De Las Lomas Group

texts.es: El señor Nelson tiene 43 años es casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos que viven con el, es natural D. la selva del Peru pero desD. joven vino a vivir a Lima, al inicio el empezo a trabajar alquilando mototaxis pero luego cuando reunio una suma simbolica pudo comprar su mototaxi. Gracias a este trabajo el ha podido comprar su terreno para poder construir su casa. Su sueño es poder tener su propia empresa D. mototaxis.
texts.en: Nelson is 43 years old, married, and the father of two small children who live with him. He is from the Peruvian jungle but came to Lima to live when he was young. At first he started working driving a rented motorcycle taxi, but eventually he was able to save a symbolic amount and purchase a motorcycle taxi of his own. His work has enabled him to purchase a plot of land where he can build a house. His dream is to run his own motorcycle taxi business one day.

loans.use: to maintain his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge 35 años de edad, el es soltero y tiene  con 01 hijo, Jorge vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en el caserío Pedregal Alto en el distrito de Tambogrande, el  cuenta con un área de terreno propio el cual trabaja.

Jorge se dedica a realizar labores  agropecuarias, el cuenta con 1.5 hectáreas de terreno agrícola , en donde viene sembrado limón el cual cosecha semanalmente y riega  diariamente, de donde cosecha 25 sacos  de limón por semana y además también se dedica a criar ganado ovino, el cual vende en promedio 3 cabezas de ganado ovino, a la semana.

Jorge esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar  fertilizantes para el cultivo de limón y así poder obtener una mejor producción y por ende logra un mejor precio de sus productos y seguir creciendo en su actividad.

Jorge es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que lo conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Jorge is 35 years old, single, and has one son.  He lives in his parents' home which is located in the small village of Pedregal Alto, in Tambogrande district.  Jorge owns his own land which he farms.

Jorge works in agriculture and owns 1.5 hectares of farm land where he grows lemons which he harvests every week and irrigates every day.  He harvests 25 sacks of lemons a week.  In addition, he raises sheep.  He sells an average of 3 head of sheep a week.

Jorge is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to buy fertilizers for his lemon crop.  This will enable him to obtain a better production and, consequently, he will obtain a better price for his products and continue growing in his business activity.

Jorge is a hard-working man who strives to get ahead in life and enjoy a better quality of life.  Those who know him consider him to be a kind person who is always ready to help others.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his lemon crop

loans.name: Manuel Augusto

texts.es:
Manuel de 40 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de túcume que pertenece del  departamento de  Lambayeque.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan sus pobladores es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Manuel se dedica ha manejar su mototaxi (transporte utilizado por las personas en rutas pequeñas), la cual trabaja mañana y tarde en la zona donde vive y a sus diferentes caseríos, a pesar de la competencia que existe el aprovecha en transportar una buena cantidad de personas.  También se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral que una vez que llegan a su desarrollo ideal los vende en los diferentes mercados de la zona,altener más ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para brindar mantenimiento a su mototaxi, comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento para que estén bien alimentados y poder ofrecerlos a un buen precio a sus clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.  Manuel es muy conocido por ser una persona de  confianza, respetuoso y responsable con sus clientes que utilizan sus transporte, con el objetivo de seguir mejorando en la vida y brindarle una mejor oportunidad académica a su hijo.
texts.en:
Manuel is 40 years old and lives with his wife and son in their own home, which only has light service.  It is located in the Túcume district in the Lambayeque department.  This area the people work in farming, livestock, and handicrafts.

Manuel works driving his mototaxi (a mode of transport used by people on short trips).  He works in the morning and afternoon in the area where he lives and its various villages.  Despite the competition that exists, he transports a good number of people.  He also works raising poultry, and once it reaches its ideal size, he sells them at different markets in his area.  Having more income will allow him to meet his family's needs.

He has asked for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to do maintenance on his mototaxi, purchase more animals, and feed for the animals so that they will be well feed, and he can offer them at a good price to his customers. With the income he earns, he will cover his loan and give his family a better quality of life.  Manuel is well known for being a trustworthy, respectful, and responsible person with the customers who use his vehicle.  His goal is to continue improving in life and to give his son a better educational opportunity.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his mototaxi, purchase more animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
Alex tiene 21 años de edad, el es soltero no presenta  carga familiar. Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Ferreñafe cuidad conocida como la tierra de la doble Fe, la distancia es de  45 minutos a la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Alex se dedica a la comercialización de animales en especialmente el de aves como patos, pavos, gallinas, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, esta actividad la realiza hace  3 años es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro, durante este tiempo, el realiza sus ventas en el mercado de Ferreñafe y también en el mercado Mochoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  En todos estos años Alex  ha adquirido clientela fija para su negocio.  

Alex está solicitando un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar animales y alimento balanceado para  el engorde de estos además adecuará corrales para una mejor crianza.

Alex  es una  persona emprendedora y responsable, ella desea poder crecer como empresaria y poder alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alex is 21 years old.  He is single and doesn't have any dependents.  He lives in his parents' home which is located in Ferreñafe district.  The town of Ferreñafe is known as the land of two faiths.  It is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Alex's business is selling animals, especially birds such as ducks, turkeys and hens.  He raises these animals in pens which are located behind his home.  He has been in this business for three years which is to say that he knows this line of work to perfection.  He makes his sales in Ferreñafe market and also in Moshoqueque market in the city of Chiclayo.  Over the years, Alex has gained regular customers for his business.

Alex is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles.  He will use this money to buy animals and balanced feed with which to fatten them.  He will also carry out some work on his pens so that he can better raise his animals.

Alex is an entrepreneurial and responsible person.  He would like to be able to grow as a businessman and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Khana Naira Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KHANA NAIRA” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Dora. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción, cultivo y servicio de filmación 

La señora Dora,  indica que hace cinco meses que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de filmación que viene trabajando hace diez años, conjuntamente su esposo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra un equipo de filmación equipo que comprará de la calle Eloy Salmón; con este equipo podrá trabajar los fines de semana filmando acontecimientos por contrato. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The village bank KHANA NAIRA is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office. The group has nine members, and Dora is the chair of the board of directors. The members' business are quite varied, and include retail, manufacturing, agriculture, and a filming business.
Dora says she's been working with Pro Mujer for five months and that she was invited to join the organization. She currently has a business selling special-occasion videos, which she and her husband have run for 10 years.
She will use this loan to purchase filming equipment on Eloy Salmón Street. She will be able to use the equipment on the weekends when she is hired to film special events. This business helps her bring in an income to support her family, since she is married and has two children.
When we ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the ability to save.

loans.use: to purchase a videocamera.

loans.name: Neyda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC II”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Neyda tiene 29 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijos  de 12 años de edad; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar según la temporada que toca, la socia trabaja en todo lo que puede y es por esta razón que ella según la época vende artículos con relación a las festividades, por ejemplo cuando estamos a vísperas de la navidad la socia invierte su dinero en la compra de mercadería navideña, juguetes, adornos para la época navideña, cuando es la época escolar la socia invierte en la compra de útiles escolares al por mayor para la venta, en la época de fiestas santas ella cambia y compra todo lo relacionado a la época para la venta, en la época de las fiestas del Cusco la socia también invierte su trabajo y compra desde gorritas, sombrillas, para la venta en los desfiles, cuando es época de brujas la socia trae de Lima la capital todo lo referente a disfraces para la época. En esta ocasión la socia desea invertir el dinero en el termino de construcción de su baño, ella desea completar la ducha y los accesorios del baño en su vivienda. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su vivienda (ducha y accesorios).

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Señor de Torrechayoc II" Communal Bank. She lives in the district and province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

This borrower, Neyda, is 29 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and has one 12 year-old son. Her daily tasks at home vary depending on the season. She works in every way that she can, so she sells different items depending on the time of year and according to the different festivals. For example, around Christmas she invests her money in the purchase of Christmas merchandise, toys, and Christmas decorations. When it is school time, she invests in the wholesale purchase of school supplies to resell. Around the festivals of the saints, she changes things and buys everything related to that season to sell. When it is time for the festivals of Cusco, she also invests in the purchase of hats and parasols to sell at the parades. During the season of witches, she goes to the capital, Lima, and brings back all sorts of costumes for the season.

At this time, Neyda would like to invest this loan in finishing construction of her bathroom. She would like to complete the shower and bathroom accessories in her home. She is requesting this loan to invest in her home (shower and bathroom accessories).

Neyda appreciates and is infinitely grateful for the loan offered to her, as it will allow her to grow in her business and to improve her quality of life. She also promises to comply with the repayment of her loan on time.

loans.use: to finish installing a shower and accessories in her bathroom

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is from the village of SAN VICENTE BAJO, OROQ. CITY.  She is 38 years old.  Eliza is single.  To make a living, Eliza owns and operates a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food products in the local community.  Eliza has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,050 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eliza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC.  Eliza is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like rice and corn grits for sale.  This loan will be the second loan taken out by Eliza from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like rice and corn grits for sale

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad  is from the village of UPPER LAMAC, OROQ. CITY.  She is 68 years old.  Caridad is married and has 3 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Caridad owns and operates a tailoring business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing women's tailoring services to local community members.  Caridad has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Caridad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Caridad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC.  Caridad is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase sewing materials and to repair an existing sewing machine.  This loan will be the twelveth loan taken out by Caridad from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials and repair the existing sewing machine.

loans.name: Nelfe

texts.en:
Nelfe, from the village of Taboc, Norte, Oroq. City, is 30 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Nelfe owns and operates a fishing business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Nelfe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 20000 PHP to invest in expanding the business by purchasing more fishing nets, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business by purchasing additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad, from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, is 62 years old, married, and has one grown child. To make a living, for over 22 years Trinidad has been planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Trinidad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to pay the labor costs for farm maintenance and to purchase fertilizer, Trinidad plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her farm.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay the labor costs for farm maintenance and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 34 years old and married with five school-aged children. She is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business raising crops and her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. 

Josephine joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to invest in expanding her business by purchasing farm products from her neighbors to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm products from her neighbors to sell

loans.name: Buyan-Orshih

texts.en:
Buyan-Orshih is 33 years old. He lives with his older sister in her home in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Since 2008, Buyan-Orshih has managed a tire repair business in his town. He is planning to continue his business in order to save enough money for the future. Besides tire repair, Buyan-Orshih provides car wash and welding services for his customers. He has many regular customers whom appreciate his fast and cheap service. Buyan-Orshih also prepares buck torn sow to supplement his income. 

Buyan-Orshih would like to expand his tire repair business and start trading auto parts. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts. Buyan-Orshih is a hardworking man who says, “One can achieve success through hard work.” In the future, he would like to have his own land where he can plant more vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Jeanna

texts.en:
Jeanna is 42 years old and married with four school-aged children. She is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. To make a living, Jeanna owns and operates a business raising crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Jeanna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. 

Jeanna joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her farm. This will be the first loan taken out by Jeanna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business. 


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Hongor

texts.en:
Hongor is 42 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. She manages a consumer goods business at a rented stall at a local market where she sells candles, socks, matches, beauty products, toilet paper, and other items. Hongor’s oldest daughter helps with the family business while her younger three children go to a local secondary school. Hongor’s husband is a herder with 100 animals. Since 2005, Hongor has been raising vegetables to supplement her family’s income. She plants a variety of vegetables for daily consumption including potatoes, carrots, and onions, and is able to harvest tons of vegetables annually.

Hongor started her retail business in 2000 and she has gained much experience. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase goods to sell. Hongor is a hardworking woman who says, “I want to have my own store in the future.”

loans.use: to purchase merchanise to sell

loans.name: Jorenda

texts.en:
Jorenda is 40 years old and married with four adult children. She is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboang del Sur. To make a living, Jorenda owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. 

Jorenda joined GDMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jorenda is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, and munchies to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Jorenda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, such as canned goods, noodles, and munchies, to sell

loans.name: Odon

texts.en:
Odon is 35 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in someone else’s backyard. They live in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her two older two children, ages 9 and 13, attend a local secondary school while her younger two children go to a kindergarten. In 2003, Odon started a shoe-making business with the help of her husband. The business is in her town and they make a variety of Mongolian traditional boots for all ages. Their business is very profitable during the cold season and therefore Odon and her husband are planning to make many shoes to sell this coming fall. Odon has a working capital of 300,000 MNT. 

Odon is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business. She is a hardworking lady who says, “One must be healthy to lead a nice life.”

loans.use: to purchase materials to make shoes

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 40 years old and married with two children. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and also earns income from raising livestock. Julieta works hard to provide for her family. She has been running her store for the past four years and has repaid three previous loans through NWTF.

Julieta is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy products to sell such as milk, groceries, and other items. In the future, Julieta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past five years, Rosa has run a sari-sari (variety) business in the Philippines. 

Rosa is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Anifel

texts.en:
Anifel is 29 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, Anifel has run a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Anifel is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy products such as shampoo, groceries, and other items to sell. She has successfully repaid eight previous loans from NWTF. 

Anifel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
As the married parent of four children, Meriam works hard to support her family. She runs a ready-to-wear and used clothing business in the Philippines. Meriam also earns additional income from selling frozen products. She has been sustaining her business activities through her hard work and 12 previous loans from NWTF.

Meriam is requesting a loan of 31,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear and used clothing to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetables vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell for her fruit and vegetables vending business. Rosemarie has been in this business for 3 years. She earns more income from dealing in beauty products.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall. She has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling purified drinking water business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more inventory of drinking water for her purified drinking water business. Evelyn has been in this business for 2 years.

Evelyn earns more income from food (banana) vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more purified drinking water and ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 51 years old and married. She has 6 children. Lucita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets and feeds. Lucita has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 61 years old and married. She has seven children. She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Marcela is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and feed for her pigs.

Marcela has been farming corn for 4 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dreams, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and feed for her pigs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 52 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari (or variety) store in the Philippines and has applied for a loan for PHP 14,000 loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, biscuits and other groceries. In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money to expand her business and provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell to her customers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Thida

texts.en: Thida (who we see here with her little daughter) is 31 years old and makes a living as a garment factory worker. Her husband, Ry, 29, makes a living producing rice wine and raising pigs at home. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to help her husband’s livestock business by buying additional pigs and feed for them to eat. The couple has been married since 2006 and has three young children, two sons and one daughter. They live along National Road No. 2, approximately 20 kilometers outside of Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs to raise and feed for them to eat.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean, a 34-year-old-married mother of five children, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for five years now and also earns an income from selling food and farming sugarcane. Having received and repaid nine previous loans from NWTF, Jean is now requesting a new one for PHP 15,000 to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Jean aspires to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is 40 years old and her husband Mao is 37 years old. They live in a village that's about 25 kilometers outside of Phnom Penh and have two children, one son and one daughter. One of their children works in a garment factory and another is still in school. Ly is also a garment factory worker and her husband earns a living as a taxi driver. Unfortunately, his motorcycle is old and needs lots of repairs. Ly is applying for her first loan, for $1,000, to buy a new motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is 39 years old, married and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari (or variety) store in the Philippines, and is applying for a loan for PHP 13,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store such as bread and other groceries. She has repaid three previous loans from NWTF and has been running her store for four years. She also earns additional money by raising pigs. Jenny's goals are to save money to educate her children and expand her livestock business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ron

texts.en:
Ron (picture here), 54, lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. She is a widow with four sons and two daughters. Two of her children are married; one is a car painter; one is a solder; another is a garment factory worker; and the other is in school.
Ron stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her children’s salaries. She is asking for a loan of $700 to build a concrete brick room under her wooden house.

loans.use: to build a concrete brick room under her wooden house.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Susana works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice and corn retailing. Susana is borrowing 19,500 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy ingredients for her food business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Jerluette

texts.en:
Jerluette is 44 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Jerluette has requested a 18,000 PHP loan from Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store such as shampoo, groceries, etc.
Jerluette has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en: Evangelina is 40 years old, married and has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who earns a living by running a weaving business in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy new materials to use in her work. Evangelina has been in this line of work for three years and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sorphoirn

texts.en:
Sorphoirn (pictured here) is 49 years old and her husband, Rotha, is 43 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have no children.
Sorphoirn is a babysitter, while her husband is a radio and television repairer. Sorphoirn has a motorbike for commuting, but the motorbike is old and breaks down, which is costly to repair. Hence Sorphoirn has decided to sell it and is asking for a loan of $600 to add to money from the sale of the old motorbike to purchase a new one.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Nem, 56, sells Onsorm. Onsorm is a kind of Cambodian cake that has rice, coconut, soybean and pork in the middle, and is cooked by steaming. Nem makes Onsorm on her own and sells it in the market about 10 kilometers from her house.
Nem's husband is a rice farmer. Nem is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help with her husband’s farming business by purchasing another ox for plowing farmland.
The photo shows Nem and her raw Onsorms at the back.

loans.use: to purchase another ox to use on her farm.

loans.name: Kemsean

texts.en: Kemsean is a soldier. His wife is a cleaner. The couple has been married since 1983 and has three sons. One is married and lives in separated home; another is now a full-time security guard. Kemsean is applying for another loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for his son to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for his son to drive to work.

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en: Koeun is a weaver, while her husband, Son, is a farmer. The couple has been married since 1978 and has 8 children — six sons and two daughters. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Koeun is requesting another loan of $1,000 to help her husband’s farming business by purchasing another ox.

loans.use: To help her husband’s farming business by purchasing an ox.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia, de 31 años de edad, originaria de Jalapa municipio del departamento de Nueva Segovia ,pero vive en Estelí , es madre de un hijo de 7 años de edad , ella se dedica a vender tortilla y comida,  lleva 13 años dedicándose a este negocio. Inicio sus actividades con dinero propio, antes su mama era quien dirigía el negocio pero después Yesenia decidió atenderlo ella misma ya que su madre enfermo y un pudo continuar con la venta de comida y tortillas, en ese entonces Yesenia tenia 27 años de edad, el negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación ,su hermana y sobrina le ayudan atender el negocio de esto han sobrevivido ella y su familia.
Solicita  el crédito para capital de trabajo, quiere comprar materia prima como arroz, maíz, frijoles, para vender comida. Con esta inversión ella espera mejorar su producto, poder adquirir con mas facilidad la materia prima para elaborar su producto y ofrecer  variedad de comidas a sus clientes, mejorar sus ventas. Ella desea ampliar su negocio, tiene dentro de sus planes alquilar un local para poner un cafetín y obtener mayores ingresos. También tiene como meta poner una tienda de ropa para ofrecer productos  de venta nuevos y variados con el firme propósito de sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Yesenia, age 31, is from the Jalapa municipality in the Nueva Segovia department.  However, she lives n Estelí.  She has a seven year old child.  She sells tortillas and food.  She has been doing this 13 years.  She started her business with her own money.  

Previously, her mother ran the business. Yesenia later decided to take care of the business because her mother got sick and could not continue selling food and tortillas.  At that time Yesenia was 27 years old.  She has her business in her home, and her sister and niece help her take care of the business.  She and her family have survived due to this business.

She is requesting a loan for working capital.  She wants to buy staples like rice, corn, and beans in order to sell food.  With this investment she plans to improve her product and to be able to more easily get ingredients for making her products.  She plans to offer a variety of food to her customers and to improve her sales.

She wants to expand her business.  She plans to rent a place to put a snack bar and get greater income.  Also, her goal is to set up a clothing store in order to offer a variety of new products.  Her firm commitment is to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy staples like rice, corn, and beans in order to sell food.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is 36 years old and married with two school-aged children. She has been growing corn for three years in the Philippines and earns about Php 30,000 per crop. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Merly hopes that her farming business will improve and be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Eddy De Jesus

texts.es:
Eddy, vive en Condega municipio de Estelí, tiene 35 años de edad, esta casado, es padre de dos hijos,de oficio agricultor, el se dedica a la siembra de frijoles. El empezó a trabajar en las labores de siembra a la edad de 10 años , ayudaba a su familia a trabajar en el campo, cuando el cumplió 15 años de edad hizo su primera siembra de ½  manzana de frijol, fue obteniendo ganancias  que le permitieron aumentar sus áreas de siembra , fue construyendo su casa, el se caso de 21 años de edad , el no pudo estudiar por los problemas económicos de su familia  pero aun así siguió adelante trabajando fuerte y duro y ahora lo que lo impulsa a seguir esforzándose son sus hijos pues el desea darles un mejor futuro que el que tuvo el , luchando por poder darles una carrera universitaria a sus hijos.  
Solicita el préstamo para sembrar 3 manzanas de frijol y 1 manzana de maíz. Con este crédito espera poder cubrir los costos de producción tales como compra de insumos, pagar mano de obra, fertilizantes, gasolina para la bomba de riego. 
El desea seguir sembrando, de hecho el quiere sembrar papas después de el cultivo de granos básicos. Su próxima meta es sacar adelante su siembra de frijol.
texts.en: Eddy lives in Condigo, in Esteli City. He is 35 years old, married and the father of two children. As a farmer, he grows beans. He began growing beans when he was ten years old. He helped his family work in the countryside. When he was 15 he had his first harvest of 1/2 a “manzana” (1.68 acres) of beans. He earned money from this, which allowed him to expand his growing areas. He built his own house and married at 21 years of age. He hasn’t been able to study because of economic problems in his family. He continued to work strong and hard. He now is motivating his children. He wants to give them a better life than he has had. He is working in order to send them to university. He is asking for this loan in order to cultivate three “manzanas” of beans and one “manzana” of corn. With this loan he hopes to cover his production costs such as buying supplies, paying for labor, buying fertilizer and buying gasoline for the irrigation pump. He would like to continue his growing season by planting potatoes after he finishes cultivating basic grains. His next goal is to progress with his work of growing beans.

loans.use: to buy supplies to grow three manzanas (1.68 acres) of beans and one "manzana" of corn.

loans.name: Chean

texts.en: Mr. Chean is a 25-year-old married man who makes a living by selling different types of clay pots in the province of Kompong Chhnang. He and wife have been operating this business since 2006 and earn around $6.75 a day to cover all their family expenses. Mr. Chean will be using his loan to purchase housing materials to mend their house. The couple is blessed with a young child who is not yet enrolled in school and is dependent on their income.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials for house repairs

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en: Dominador is 47 years old and married with three school-aged children. He grows corn and has been doing it for 10 years. He earns about Php 30,000 per crop as a farmer working in the Philippines. Dominador is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds to grow. In the future, Dominador hopes that his farming business will improve and support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds to grow

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 40 years and has a general shop where she sells a variety of products. She has had this business for five years. Myrna is married with five adult children. She is requesting a loan of Php6,000 to purchase products like condiments, soft drinks, soaps and canned goods — the most popular products in her store. In the future, Myrna hopes that her business will further improve to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase products like condiments, soft drinks, soaps and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married with four children. Rosemarie is 43 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. 

Rosemarie owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 5,000 to purchase more products such as soap, shampoo, and toothpaste for her general store.

Rosemarie has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to use the additional income from the business to supplement her family's income and use for their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as shampoo and soap for her general store

location.town: La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Mann

texts.en: Mrs. Mann, 33, is a businesswoman who currently lives in the best territory of Kompong Chhnang Province. Since 1990, she has owned a small kiosk in her community which she uses to store many kinds of clay pots to sell to her neighbors and tourists. Mrs. Mann is able to earn an average profit of US$2 per day to pay for daily expenses. She also depends on the income of her husband who is a firewood seller in and around his village. Mrs. Mann has also been working in farming as an annual activity. As the rainy season is coming, Mrs. Mann is looking for a loan to buy two cows because her old cows do not support her farm work.

loans.use: to buy two cows to support her farming

loans.name: Ariel Francisco

texts.es:
Ariel, de 26 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Estelí, es padre de familia tiene 2 hijos, el se dedica a vender CD, DVD  de películas y música, atraves de esta actividad mantiene a su familia, el lleva 4 años con este negocio. Ariel comenzó como vendedor ambulante de CD de música a los 22 años de edad ,su esposa aporto dinero para que empezara con el negocio de venta de CD ,vendía en las calles, ferias , eventos recreativos ,parques , recorría barrios para poder vender sus CD sin tener horario ni salario fijos pues solo dependía de lo que vendía durante el día . Hoy en día gracias a su gran esfuerzo y duro trabajo tiene una pequeña tienda de ventas de CD y DVD el ya no vende ambulante.
Solicito el crédito para capital de trabajo  quiere surtir su local de CD y DVD con el propósito de tener mas variedad de mercadería que ofrecer a sus clientes.  El espera que con esta inversión le ayude a crecer su negocio, además el vende por cantidades a vendedores ambulantes y por tal motivo necesita tener suficiente mercadería.
En lo futuro le gustaría tener un negocio de venta de granos básicos, para tener otra fuente de ingresos y no solo depender de la venta de CD. La meta próxima aumentar las ventas de CD de músicas y DVD.
texts.en: Ariel is 26 years old and lives in Estelí City. He is a father with two children. He sells CD’s and DVD’s of movies and music. He supports his family with this activity that he has been doing for the past four years. Ariel began working as a roving salesperson, selling music CD’s, when he was 22 years old. His wife provided the money to start this CD sales business. He sold CD’s on the street, at fairs, at recreation events, in parks and he walked through neighborhoods selling CD’s. He didn’t have a fixed schedule or salary. Both of these depended on what he sold during the day. Today, thanks to great effort and hard work, he has a small store where he sells CD’s and DVD’s. He doesn’t have to be a roving salesperson anymore. He is asking for this loan in order to have working capital. He would like to have a larger variety of CD’s and DVD’s in order to have a larger variety of goods to offer his customers. He hopes that with this investment he will be able to expand his business. He now sells, at larger quantities, his product to other roving street vendors. For this reason he needs sufficient merchandise. In the future he would like to have a store that sells basic grains in order to have another source of income so he is not as dependant on CD sales. His next goal is to increase his music CD sales and DVD sales.

loans.use: buy CD's and DVD's of music and movies so that he can provide a larger assortment to his customers.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is married with four school-aged children. Rodrigo is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for eight years.

Rodrigo is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizer and seeds to grow. Rodrigo hopes that through this loan, his farming business will improve. Currently, Rodrigo earns PHP 30,000 per harvest.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs. Som weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished product to buyers who come directly to her house in Kompong Chhnang Province. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make extra income. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and to weave baskets. Recently, Mrs. Som ran out of essential materials from her stock supply. She hopes to acquire more raw materials to continue making baskets. She is using her Kiva loan as an advance. Mrs. Som is a 30-year-old married woman blessed with two children who are attending the local school. The couple are shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to continue making baskets for sale.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 30 years old and married with one school-aged child. He earns about PHP 35,000 per cropping as a farmer working in the Philippines.

Ricardo grows corn. He has been doing this for 13 years. Ricardo is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow. 

In the future, Ricardo hopes that his farming business will improve to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Nasibahon's Group

texts.en:
Nasibahon is the leader of this group.  She is 35 and married to a builder. Together with her husband, she brings up two daughters and a son. The son studies at school and the daughters are preschool age (under seven). Seventeen years ago, with an initial investment of 4000 soms, Nasibahon started cultivating and selling agricultural products. The monthly profit from this activity is 2,300 soms. This profit made it possible to repair the house and build a summer kitchen. With money received from the loan, Nasibahon wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for growing cotton. In the future, she wants to purchase a piece of land to increase the profits gained from cultivating agricultural products.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: From Siem Reap Province, Mrs. Kong is a 45-year-old rice farmer. She also sells a few goods to her neighbors. She is a widow and currently lives with her four single children: two work in a various jobs while the other two are at school. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow vegetables. She often gets a good result from her crop-planting business and makes around $3 a day. She will use the loan to buy a used motor for transportation. With the rest of the funds she will purchase additional goods for sale and also repair her old house.

loans.use: to buy a used motor for transportation

loans.name: Shohidahon's Group

texts.en:
Shohidahon is the leader of this group. She is 41 and married to a foreman. His monthly salary is 5,000 soms. Shohidahon’s older son works as a furniture maker and earns 4,000 soms per month. The son tries to help his parents with housework and each month he contributes some money to meet their needs. In order to earn money for the family budget, Shohidahon cultivates and sells cotton. In this way, she earns 3,000 soms per month. She applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds to purchase mineral fertilizers. She hopes to get a good harvest this year. With the profits gained, she wants to purchase a vehicle for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilziers

loans.name: Thing

texts.en: The woman who appears in the photograph is Mrs. Thing. She is a resident of Siem Reap Province. She and her husband work together in the coal-selling business. They use their old motorbike to pick up their goods to sell, but their existing motorcycle is broken. They take it to be repaired at least twice a week. It is required for their business. To solve this issue, Mrs. Thing has decided to seek a Kiva loan, as an advance, to purchase a motor-trailer to replace the broken one.

loans.use: to purchase a motor-trailer.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with five children. Alexander has a shop that sells gasoline per liter. He has had this business for six years. He requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional gallons of gasoline. Alexander has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Alexander hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of gasoline

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children
. 
Amelita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy additional canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Amelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Amelita hopes to see her business investment will be more successful and could invest successful things to her family especially to her six children.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Avelina has a shop that sells canned goods, biscuits & snacks. She has had this business for 16 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, detergents, noodles & biscuits. In the picture are Avelina and her grandson.

Avelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Avelina hopes to expand  her business if profit will be enough. Avelina will be more happy for this.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents, noodles & biscuits

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Grace has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & different kinds of beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional stocks of groceries & beverages.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Grace hopes to expand  her business so that she could be able to provide the needs of her neighborhood and the rest of the of her family needs.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries & beverages to sell

loans.name: Bevelyn

texts.en:
Bevelyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Bevelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Bevelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Bevelyn hopes to expand her business so that Bevelyn could give the needs of her children out from the profit she could gain.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Cecile has a retail shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy bundles of used clothing or ukay-ukay.

Cecile is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Cecile hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing or ukay-ukay

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Chita has a shop that sells different varieties of fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy additional stocks of fish.

Chita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Chita hopes to succeed on her business so that she could experience a well life living together with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Artykul's Group

texts.en:
Artykul is the leader of this group.  She is 53 and married to a driver. Together with her husband, she has raised four children. Three of the children are married and live separately with their families.  The youngest daughter, 18, just graduated from school and is going to enter the university. In order to earn money to meet the family needs, Artykul breeds livestock animals and then resells them at a higher price. In this way, she earns an additional 2,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase two more farm animals for breeding. In the near future, Artykul wants her daughter to enter a good university.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 45 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with three children.

To earn a living, Mario has a business selling rice products. He earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Mario has requested a loan to purchase more sacks of rice.

Mario has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Mario would like to use the additional income from his business to pay his children's  school tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with three children. 

Edna has a meat shop that sells pork & chicken meat. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy additional stock of pork & chicken meat to sell.

Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional pork & chicken meat to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Edna has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Edna is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Esmeralda has a retail shop that sells dried fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of dried fish.

Esmeralda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Esmeralda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Esther has a retail shop that sells firewood. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional firewood to sell.

Esther is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Esther hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Ornn

texts.en: Mrs Ornn, 49, is a widow who lives in a small wooden house in Siem Reap Province. She is a rice farmer and earns approximately $3 profit a day. She also raises a few pigs at her home. She has four children, two of whom are employed as building construction workers and they normally share responsibility with Mrs Ornn. She would like to use the loan of $800 to buy extra piglets for feeding up and to purchase sugar to stock for future sale.

loans.use: to buy extra piglets.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Jenny is into corn farming. She sells corn grain after harvesting the cornfield every three months. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizers for her cornfield.

Jenny is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jenny hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cornfield

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Jocelyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, detergents, noodles & snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Jocelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 52 years old and lives in New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 10 children.

Anita has a general store selling shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc. to earn a living. She has had this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase more variety of products such as soap, shampoo and toothpaste for her general store.

Anita has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more variety products such as shampoo, toothpaste, and soap for her store

location.town: New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en: Mrs Sorm is a 55-year-old village woman who has been a rice farmer since before she was married. Her husband is a local fisherman. She currently sells fresh fish that she gets from her husband or that she buys from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She runs her business in the market and is earning approximately $1.55 a day. The humble couple has three children, one of whom is single and the remaining two are already married. As the rainy season approaches, it is a good time for Mrs Sorm to begin planting her rice crop. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to pay for her field to be ploughed as she has done in previous years.

loans.use: to pay for ploughing costs.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Julieta has a food shop that sells chicken & pork barbecue and viands like chicken & pork adobo. She has had this business for 22 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients like meat & spices.

Julieta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like meat & spices

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Juvelyn has a retail shop selling canned goods, noodles & biscuits. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of  PHP 5,000 to buy additional canned goods, snacks & biscuits.

Juvelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Juvelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks & biscuits

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children.
 
Marianita has a shop that sells different kinds of dried fish. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of  PHP 5,000 to buy more stock of dried fish.

Marianita has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Marianita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Making baskets is a part of 70-year-old Meas’ daily routine. She currently buys raw materials to make baskets to sell at home, in Kompong Chhnang Province. She also buys baskets from other weavers at a reasonable price and resells them to gain extra profits. She has done this since 1990. Meas is the mother of three married children. Two of her children are employed in the same occupation as her. She will be using her loan to help her child to pay for documents so they can apply for work more easily.

loans.use: to pay for documents for her child to apply for work.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Michelle has a retail shop that sells canned goods, junk food & snacks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of  PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, junk food & biscuits.

Michelle is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Michelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, junk food & biscuits

loans.name: Marcelita

texts.en:
Marcelita is 43 years old and lives in Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with five children.

She works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 18 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell.

Marcelita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Marcelita hopes to save money from this business for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a hardworking married man with six children living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility to take care of the family solely rests on him and his desire is to educate his children. 

For ten years he has been farming and he has specialised in maize growing since the crop is very profitable. He faces the challenge of price fluctuation, and his dream is to grow maize extensively. Peter intends to use the loan facility to prepare land for maize growing.

loans.use: to prepare land for maize growing.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. Alma is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Alma has been in this business for six years. 

Alma requested a 28,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell for her store. 

In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Myrna has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages & biscuits. She has had this business for 16 years. She requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Myrna hopes to her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is married and has four school-aged children. Joselito is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for 20 years. 

Joselito is asking for a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizer and seed to grow. Joselito hopes this loan will expand his operations. Currently, Joselito earns 35,000 PHP every harvest season. 

In the future, Joselito hopes to have bigger farmland to cultivate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow

loans.name: Nargel

texts.en:
Nargel is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Nargel has a retail shop that sells beverages, canned goods, biscuits & snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & biscuits.

Nargel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Nargel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & biscuits

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with five children.
 
Norma has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & biscuits.

Norma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Norma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & biscuits

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a fifty-one-year-old single mother of four children living in her own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. All her children are above eighteen and are self-sustaining. 

She sells clothes and is also a poultry farmer; she started with the local breed and later bought broilers. She faces a challenge in the high cost of feed and her dream is to diversify and raise egg-laying chickens. It is for this reason that she needs a loan.

loans.use: To buy chickens for egg production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Osita

texts.en:
Osita is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Osita has a shop that sells coconut wine, snacks & firewood. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional snacks, coconut wine & firewood.

Osita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Osita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional snacks, coconut wine & firewood

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Mr. Chuon is a 31-year-old, married man and is blessed with two children who are teenagers. He is a domestic construction foreman in the mobile, Kompong Chhnang Province. His wife sells a few produce items in her small store in front of their home. Mr. Chuon is also very skilled at taking beautiful pictures but he lacks the capital to buy a modern camera to provide photographic services. This is the reason Mr. Chuon has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL.

loans.use: to buy a modern camera to provide photographic services

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 45 years old and married. She has 2 children. Elsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Elsa has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 9 years and also earns an income from clothing sales. Elsa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Regina has a food shop that sells bread, rice & cheese cakes, and beverages. She also serves coffee. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional breads, beverages & coffee powder.

Regina has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Regina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional breads, beverages & coffee powder

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 34 years old. She is married and has 6 children. Vivian works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17000 loan, through NWTF, to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Vivian has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 1 year and also earns an income from a vulcanizing shop, farming vegetables and livestock.

Vivian aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is 57 years old. She is married and has 9 children. With 1 child still in school, Encarnacion works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like juices, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Encarnacion has been in this business for 38 years and sells a variety of items such as milk, curds, bread, cooking oil, etc. In the future, Encarnacion would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an additional sack of cashew nuts & peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs for rearing.

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina is 43 years old. She is married and has 5 children. With 4 children in school, Filipina works very hard to provide for them.
