Filipina runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soy sauce, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store. She has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as spices, chips, bread, etc. In the future, Filipina would like to save enough to provide secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en: Caleb, a 46-year-old married father of four children, sells second-hand clothes to earn a living for his family. Previously he worked in mining, so his business is only a year old. Thanks to the training conducted by Faulu Kenya on financial management, Caleb has learned how to manage his finances.     He is now requesting a loan of 15,000 Kes to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en: Romulo, a 40-year-old married father of a grown child, has been a farmer growing corn for the past 10 years in the Philippines. His wife works as a housewife and helps him in managing their farmland. Romulo is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizer and seed, and hopes in the future to improve his farm to better support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun, 38, is a married woman and the mother of three single children who are all not yet employed and dependent on her daily income. She doesn’t have a life partner as she has been divorced from her husband for years. She makes a living by selling a few vegetables in a very busy local market in Siem Reap Province. She is an energetic and determined woman who has worked hard to earn enough money to feed all her children since they were very young. Presently, she faces a problem: her house is too old and it is broken in some parts. To solve this, Mrs. Chhun would like to request a loan to repair and decorate her house.

loans.use: to repair and decorate her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beans for planting.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 50-year-old lady who lives with her husband and five children in Zimmerman, Nairobi, Kenya.  She operates a cafeteria so as to help her husband with household expenses including educating her five children who are in school.  Her dream is to own a big restaurant in the future.  

Margaret has requested her first loan of 10,000 Kes to buy cooking fat, maize flour, maize and beans.  The ingredients will help her to prepare good food in the cafeteria.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, maize flour, maize and beans.

loans.name: Slethulwazi Group

texts.en:
Simangele is 27 years old and single  with two children,  five and eight years old. Both attend school. She also takes cares of one relative who lives with her. She sells cold drinks from her home in Mtubatuba, South Africa. She is raising her hand in the photo above; she is the second from the left.

She's been in this business for eight years and she also receives a child support grant from the government. She would like to see her business growing over five years' time, having a proper space in town to sell.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses to buy skirts, shirts and jerseys. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her buy enough food for her family. 

She appreciates WDB and KIVA very much.

loans.use: To buy clothes and cold drinks.

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: Mrs. Ke, 29, is homemaker. She stays at home to care for her child and maintains a daily routine. Her husband provides for the family’s expenses with his income as a domestic construction worker. He can earn approximately US$5 per day. Her husband always rents a motorbike when he needs to get to work as he doesn’t have his own vehicle. To address this situation, Mrs. Ke has applied for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to ride to his work place. Mrs. Ke married many years ago and is blessed with only one kid who is still enrolled in the public school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to ride to his work place.

loans.name: Popoteke Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 48-year-old Maves (holding the yellow folder) from Masvingo. She is married with four children aged 16, 19, 23 and 26.  All four children attend school. She also cares for two dependents. 

Maves runs a retail business selling clothing and footwear. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenge faced are debtors failing to pay up on time. 

Maves has requested a loan of $300 to increase her stock. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her quality of life. In the future Maves plans to have grown her business to a point that it can stand alone.

loans.use: to increase stock in her clothing and footwear business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell at his modest retail shop.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, a 25-year-old, is married and blessed with a six-year-old child who is in school. To earn a living, she grows vegetables. Besides this, she also works as a casual laborer to generate additional income.  

Cecilia joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that she would have access to financial resources easily because the members of the group guarantee each others loans.  She has also managed to grow her business through Faulu Kenya, hence improving her living standards. She has requested for 20,000 Kes to buy seedlings.

loans.use: to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 39 years old. She is a married woman who has 7 children. She is engaged in rice and animal farming. She tills her land to grow rice crops. She also raises chickens to sell. Corazon works hard to provide for the needs of her household.

Corazon has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and chickens to raise. She hopes that this loan will help to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and chickens to raise.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 43 year old, married man with 3 children. He earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. James is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase of fertilizers and pesticides for his rice farm.

James has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport operator. He is working tirelessly towards the attainment of his dream: to build and expand his business in order to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizers and pesticides for his rice farm.

loans.name: Lem

texts.en: From the province of Siem Reap, Mr. Lem, aged 54, makes a living driving a taxi motorcycle, picking up passengers in and around his community. Mr. Lem currently earns an average of $2 a day and has been running his service for a long time. He is the father of two children, both of whom are married and have been working in different trades. His wife sells different kinds of goods in front of his house. Mr. Lem would like a loan which will enable his wife to buy more items to sell. Mr. Lem is pictured in front of his wife's kiosk.

loans.use: to support his wife's business by buying more items to sell.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia is 48 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Verginia works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari(variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase inventory for her sari-sari store business. Verginia has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soft-drinks, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future, Verginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 26-year-old married lady with three children in school.  She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years.  She also relies on her husband's employment for financial support.  She says that she has managed to expand her business through Faulu Kenya and she has one employee.  

Her dream is to expand her business into wholesale in five years.  Gladys plans to open another retail shop at a different locality.  For this reason, she has requested  a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings.

loans.use: To open another retail shop

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 56-year-old Rosemary (holding the yellow folder) from Masvingo. She is married with four children. She also cares for two dependents. Rosemary runs a retail trading business  where she sells clothing, fruit and vegetables. She does have additional sources of income. Her business has been in operation for 8 years. She says the main challenge she faces is competition. 

Rosemary has requested a loan of $400 to increase her store's stock. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of her family. In the future, Rosemary plans to operate from an outlet.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 54 years old and married with three children.

Rosenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items for her store to sell.

Rosenda has borrowed and repaid 17 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 12 years.  She also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rosenda aspires to save enough money so she can raise more pigs and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for her store to sell

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is 52 years old and has six children.  Victoriana is married and has two children who are in school.

Victoriana is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  Victoriana requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and piglets.

Victoriana has been raisig pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Victoriana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 42 years old and married with three children.  With 1 child in school, Ruby works very hard to provide for them.

Ruby runs a generals tore in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Ruby has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, rice, canned goods, diapers,etc. 

In the future Ruby would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock like soft-drinks, snack etc. to sell in her stall

loans.name: Thong

texts.en: Thong, aged 47, is a village woman living in Siem Reap Province. Since the beginning of 2008, she has owned and operated her sales business in front of her house. She sells items like cooking ingredients, water, shampoo and other essential products. She typically makes $3 profit a day to meet her family’s daily expenses. Her husband, Hong, 49, is a local farmer. They have three children who are not married. With this loan, Thong will purchase additional items to continue selling. With the remainder, she will buy a power generator. This will enable the family to accrue extra profit to meet their daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell and a power generator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items like rice, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 49 years old and is a married woman with 3 children.  The oldest child is 19 years old.  Her husband is a rice farmer.

Julita sells fruits and vegetables that she buys from local farmers.  She started this business 3 years ago.  She earns about 4,000 PHP from this business.  She also raises pigs in her backyard.  Julita sells her pigs at her town's market.

This loan will be used to buy pig feed and more fruits and vegetables to sell.  She hopes for her business to prosper.  She also desires to have her children finish college and have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for five years and earns additional income from buying and selling  fish. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat. Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF and dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and one child. He has owned a small grocery store since 1998, where he sells dairy and daily products, detergents, etc.  He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. He cooperates with his wife who works in a local company in order to earn a good income and to have a good standard of living.

He has obtained his first Kiva loan and has been an excellent client with payments on time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his store’s inventory. In the future, he is planning to expand his business by enlarging his shop and adding home products to his inventory.

loans.use: increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is a 56-year-old widow who now resides in the province of Siem Reap. She has been living with her five married children, most of whom are employed in various work. Ly grows a few crops on a plot of her fertile land. This rice-growing season she wants to plant a rice crop but she doesn’t have sufficient capital to do this. Ly needs a loan from Kiva in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer to make her crops grow well.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kibonwa Tukwatanise Group

texts.en:
Siras, 39, sells bananas, one of Uganda's favorite delicacies. Most people in Uganda enjoy partaking of a local dish called matooke which is made out of bananas, so those selling such foods do a brisk business. Siras also sells other commodities such as maize and rice as well as cows, goats, and poultry. His business has been in existence for the past 25 years, and during that time this happily-married father of eight has worked hard and made significant progress.

With his portion of the loan, Siras will purchase a cow whose milk he will sell. This, he says, will earn him more revenue as milk also sells well in Ntungamo.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Sehouegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEHOUEGNON est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ablavi Pierrette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ablavi Pierrette est née le 12 janvier 1967 dans une ville du Bénin. Ablavi Pierrette est une veuve qui vit seule avec ses enfants. Ablavi Pierrette  a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et encore à sa charge. Ablavi Pierrette n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Ablavi Pierrette mène comme activité la vente de condiments de sauce (tomates, oignons, etc.). De façon secondaire, Ablavi Pierrette vend divers produits (lait, etc.) et du maïs depuis neuf ans. Ablavi Pierrette s’approvisionne au Bénin et vend ses produits à son domicile. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Ablavi  Pierrette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEHOUEGNON, un troisième  crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group SEHOUEGNON consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. Pierrette Ablavi, the group’s representative, is seen in the photo with her hand raised. She was born January 12, 1969 in a city of Benin. She is a widow, and lives alone with her three dependent children who all attend school. Pierrette herself never received formal schooling. 

To support herself and her children, Pierrette sells sauce condiments (tomatoes, onions, etc.) and as a sideline, she also sells various items such as milk and maize. She has been engaged in this activity for nine years. She gets her stock in Benin and conducts her sales from her home. 

In order to meet the needs of her customers and increase her profits and revenue, Pierrette Ablavi is seeking a third loan together with the other members of the SEHOUEGNON group. All previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy baskets of tomatoes, sacks of maize and cartons of milk for resale

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo, a 35-year-old farmer and father of two children aged four and two, lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Marcelo primarily grows rice to sell, a business he started five years ago which now earns him about 4000 PHP per month.

Marcelo's loan will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to have his own capital someday and be able to save for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, a 39-year-old married father of three children in school, owns rental houses which earn him a living. In business for only two years, he employs a caretaker to collect rent and check on the houses. George works hard in his business so as to provide for the family and educate his children.

He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to install electricity in his rental houses and dreams of building apartments so that he can generate more income in the future.

loans.use: to install electricity in his rental houses.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is a 41-year-old married mother of four children,.the oldest 20 and the youngest 16 years of age. Zenaida makes fruit salad, rice cakes and other delicacies which she sells to the people in her community, a business she has had for five years. She plans to use her loan to buy milk, flour, sugar and other ingredients.  In the future, Zenaida hopes to have a better house for her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, flour, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 17 years old and married with three children. For the past five years, she has been earning a living as a rice farmer in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from trading rice that she buys. 

Gemma is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with one parent and two siblings. 

She has been working as a bread and rosewater producer since 2007. Her work is based at her house. She sells her goods to customers from her community. She works hard to support her family financially. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1500 US from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional products. She says that the loan will help her increase her business productivity and therefore her sales. In the future, she is planning to open a small shop and start her own trading business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products needed

loans.name: Inass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 35 years old, married and has 2 children.

Inass has had a beauty salon for women and brides since 2002. She has more than 8 years experience in this field and has a good reputation, being well known in her area.

She is requesting a $3000 US loan to buy furniture for her salon and a massage machine. She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality life.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her salon and a massage machine.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 66 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 15 years, Lilia has operated a spice and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

Lilia is requesting a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional spices and vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spices and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Live Show Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! In the middle of this picture you will see 37-year-old Nyasha from Mutare. She is married and has four children, ages 2, 8, 11 and 17. Three of her children attend school.  For the past three years, Nyasha has run a cross-border business at a flea market where she sells clothing. Her main business challenge is the lack of working capital. 

Nyasha is requesting a loan of 400 USD to purchase more clothing to sell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to have more disposable income and thus improve her quality of life. In the future, Nyasha plans to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old Lebanese man living with his wife and seven children, three of whom are still attending school. He has owned a carpentry business since 1997, where he manufactures diverse wood designs. On overloaded workdays, he gets help from two employees in order to accomplish the work on time and satisfy his customer’s demands. 

He has obtained his first Kiva loan and has been a very good client with punctual payments. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 US from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase wood needed for his newest projects. In the future, he is planning to improve his work and expand his business operation by taking on bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 45-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents. She has owned a small shop from the past two years where she sells children's clothes, women's lingerie, and all related items. Her business income is very important because she is the sole income provider for her family. 

With her loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, she intends to increase her store’s inventory. In the future, she is planning to enlarge her business and start selling clothes designed for both men and women.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs Keo is a businesswoman who earns a low income. She has been operating her sales business since the beginning of 2010. 

In the front her house she has a kiosk where she sells different kinds of goods. She sells items such as soft drinks, beauty products and some cooking ingredients. 

Mrs Keo is married to 21-year-old Mman, who works as a furniture maker. The couple is blessed with a young child who is still not enrolled in school. 

In order to earn extra profits, Mrs Keo will be using the loan she has requested to help her husband to purchase the equipment for making tables and chairs.

loans.use: to assist her husband to purchase equipment to make tables and chairs.

loans.name: Ave Maria Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AVE MARIA est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jeanine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jeanine est née le 26 juin 1963 au Bénin et est mariée à un certain Paulin. Le couple à quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jeanine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Jeanine mène comme activité depuis dix ans la vente des tubercules d’ignames. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Jeanine s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Jeanine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AVE MARIA, un troisième crédit.
texts.en: The Ave Maria group is made up of three women from the same neighborhood.  This is the third time that the group is requesting financial aid through ALIDé, in order to strengthen their business.  The group representative, named Jeanine, has her hand raised in the photo.  Jeanine was born on June 26, 1963 in Benin and her husband’s name is Paulin.  The couple has four children, all of whom are in school and under their care.  Jeanine lives with her husband and children, and the couple shares the household expenses.  To do this, Jeanine has been selling yams for ten years.  This business allows her to meet her and her children’s needs.  Jeanine buys her yams in one of the markets of Benin.  With the goal of satisfying her customers and increasing her business income, Jeanine is requesting a third credit, along with the other members of the Ave Maria group.

loans.use: to buy bags of yams.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng is a 47-year-old man who provides the motor taxi service to people who need to go anywhere in and around Kompong Cham Province. He has over 10 years' experience in this occupation and frequently earns around $1.50 each day to support his family with financial expenses. 

In order to contribute to their income, Heng’s wife works in a farm field planting a crop twice per year. They have four children who live under the roof with them. One of their children works in a garment factory as a sewing worker. Heng will be using his loan to buy a new motorcycle to replace the old one which often breaks down.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to replace the old one which often breaks down.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his purchases.

loans.name: Adidjatou

texts.fr: Née en 1964 au Bénin, Adidjatou est mariée à un certain Léon. Le couple à cinq enfants, tous scolarisés dont un reste encore à leur charge. Adidjatou vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Adidjatou assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis seize ans environs, Adidjatou vend des tissus de façon ambulante. Adidjatou s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les diverses charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Adidjatou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits dont Adidjatou avait bénéficié ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Born in 1964 in Benin, Adidjatou is married to a man named Léon.  The couple has five children, all of whom attend school and one of whom is still under their care.  Adidjatou lives with her husband and children, and the couple shares the household expenses.  For about sixteen years, Adidjatou has been selling fabric door to door.  She buys her fabric in one of the large markets in Benin.  This business brings her income to help pay the family’s various expenses.  With the goal of increasing her business activity and raising her profits, Adidjatou is requesting a third loan through ALIDé.  She has repaid her first two loans.

loans.use: to buy four pieces of fabric and damask fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children who are still attending school. He started running his own business back in 2006. His job consists in selling a large variety of car accessories. His wife who works in a local school assists him in paying the household expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his store’s inventory. He hopes that these purchases will continue to generate good profits and enable him to expand his business even further.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items for her mobile phone business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three young children. In 2006, he opened his own store where he sells a wide range of home products such as spoons, knifes, coffee cups, platters, etc… These kinds of stores are popular throughout Lebanon and require salesmen to be constantly aware of customer’s needs.

At the same time, he works as a freelance mechanic serving customers wherever they face car damage. It’s very common in Lebanon to have multiple jobs because it is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. 

Today, this client is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional products and supplies to attract more customers and make a good profit. He feels positive about his business potential for the upcoming years.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and supplies.

loans.name: Chean

texts.en: Chean, aged 60, is a rice farmer. She is a widow who currently lives with her daughter who works in the tobacco factory in Kompong Cham Province. Chean sells a few produce goods in her small store in front of her home. Chean’s daughter is concerned that she faces difficulties in traveling to her workplace because she doesn't have her own vehicle. To solve the problem, Chean has requested a loan to buy a second motorcycle for her daughter to ride to work.

loans.use: to buy a second motorcycle for her daughter to ride to work.

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr: Née en 1976 au Bénin, Alimatou est mariée à Issa, un commerçant. Le couple à quatre enfants, tous à charges et scolarisés. Trois sont leurs propres enfants. Alimatou n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Alimatou prépare de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs, igname, accompagnés de diverses sauces) qu'elle vend dans son quartier depuis près de huit ans. Grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité, Alimatou contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Alimatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin.  Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie et son revenu, Alimatou sollicite pour une troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Born in 1976 in Benin, Alimatou is married to Issa, a shopkeeper.  The couple has four children under their care and attending school.  Three are their own children.  Alimatou never attended school.  To help meet her and her children’s needs, for about eight years she has been preparing food (rice, corn mush, yams, accompanied by various sauces) to sell in her neighborhood.  She buys her ingredients in the market of Benin.  Thanks to her income from this business, Alimatou helps to pay her family’s various expenses.  With the goal of satisfying her customers and improving her quality of life and her income, Alimatou is requesting her third loan through ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, corn, yams, and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a new sound system.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 42-year-old married man with five children who lives in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is the head of the family and his dream is to educate his children so they can obtain their degrees. For the past year, Patrick has been in the transportation business after practicing farming for a long time. His main business challenge is the poor road network which leads to many motorcycle breakdowns. 

Patrick is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle. His desire is to have at least four motorcycles to maintain his business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase manure for his banana farm

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Chhem is a resident of Siem Reap Province where he plants a few crops on his existing fertile farm. Since 1999, he has been spending his life working in his farming business. He can earn an average of US$2.50 a day to use for cash expenses. Besides this job, he also buys firewood from other villagers to burn in a coal oven to produce charcoal and then sell for more profit. He is a widower and currently lives with his seven children some of whom already have jobs. 

Due to a lack of money, Chhem decided to seek a loan to purchase farming materials such as paying for plowing, buying fertilizer, and other supplies to begin a farming business. With the remainder of the loan, he will purchase additional firewood for firing into charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, to buy seed, and to purchase additional firewood for firing into charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rapheal

texts.en:
Rapheal is 70 years old and is an ambitious man who has six children. He lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Almost all of his children are self-sustaining apart from two who are at university. After saving money from his agricultural activities, Rapheal has been a landlord for the past 13 years. His main business challenge is tenants who delay their rent payments. 

Rapheal is requesting a loan to renovate his rental houses. In the future, his dream is to expand his profitable business and build more houses to rent.

loans.use: to renovate rental houses

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 35-year-old married man with four children. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. Ibrahim has been in the coffee production business for fourteen years and has grown his business substantially. His main business challenge is his lack of enough working capital. 

Ibrahim is requesting a loan to buy coffee to sell. In the future, his vision is to own a processing plant.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is an honest and hardworking woman. She has one child. For 10 years Firuza has been running a farming business. She cultivates potatoes and sells them after harvest. Furuza tries to work harder because she wants to make a good profit and build a house. 

Firuza is requesting a loan of 3,000 TJS to purchase seed and fertilizer for her land to improve her harvest.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 28 years old and is married with three children. He owns a house in Kasese. For the past three years, John has run a retail shop. He is requesting a loan to purchase clothes and saucepans to sell. In the future, he would like to educate his children and expand his business to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy clothes and saucepans to sell

loans.name: Khayom

texts.en:
Khayom is 29 years old and he is married. His wife is a housewife. For 10 years, Khayom has been running the services of filming weddings and different events. Soon, he is going to be a loving father and he needs to make a good profit for his child. Khayom would like to get a loan of 5,000TJS for purchasing of equipment for his business. This will allow him to provide his clients with a high quality of filming. He will invest his profit in the expansion of his business.

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a 40-year-old farmer from village Charnali, West Georgia. She is married and lives in the village with her husband Mamia and two sons (19 and 21 years old). Mamia is 52 years old; he is a metal worker by trade. Also he has a tractor and provides services to neighborhood farms, earning additional income for the family. Liana’s sons are students at a high school.

Liana’s family owns 0.4 ha of agricultural land, where vegetables are grown. Harvested vegetables are sold locally to vegetable retailers. Also they have one milk cow, whose milk is sold locally. 

The total average monthly income of the family is approximately 670 Laris. 

With the requested credit, Liana plans to purchase an additional milk cow. The family will get and sell more milk and increase their income. The increase in income will be used for purchasing new household goods in order to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Zebuniso

texts.en:
Zebuniso is an active single girl. She has a secondary education and she is engaged in the cultivating of wheat and potatoes. She started her business with cultivating potatoes when she studied at school. Her brother and sister help her in this business and they work together harmoniously. Zebuniso would like to get a loan of 5,000 TJS for purchasing mineral fertilizers and pesticides, which will allow her to get a good harvest and to make a good profit. With the profit that she hopes to make, she would like to purchase a sewing machine.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase high grade manure for his banana farms.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 39 year old husband to Janet, a housewife. He and his wife have two children. Martin is an industrious carpenter who operates a carpentry workshop at Kibuye – a large open air market within Kisumu town. He has been working there for the last sixteen years. He designs household items like beds, tables and any furniture, as per client specifications. He makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Martin recently joined KADET LTD and has qualified for a first loan of KES 20,000 which he will use to buy carpentry materials like nails, velvet materials and polish. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more materials for his workshop, since his dream is to have a big carpentry workshop within Kibuye market area.

loans.use: to purchase timber, nails and velvet for the carpentry business.

loans.name: Mirna Del Carmen

texts.es: Mirna del Carmen vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos los cuales aun asisten a la escuela. Ella   posee una tienda y es muy visitada por los clientes pues el lugar es muy concurrido D. personas; se ha hecho D. nueva clientela pues Mirna siempre los atienD. con una sonrisa en el rostro y siempre les venD. lo que necesitan a precios accesibles, ella es muy dedicada a su trabajo y cada día lo desempeña como si fuera el último es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos como golosinas, granos básicos, bebidas, pan, sopas instantáneas entre otros. D. esta forma Mirna lograra cumplir su meta que es ver crecer su negocio con el cual tiene toda la confianza que lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida
texts.en:
Mirna del Carmen lives in her own house with her two children, who still attend school. She has a store, and many customers visit it so it is a very crowded place; she has gotten new customers because Mirna always serves them with a smile on her face and always sells them what they need at reasonable prices.

She is very dedicated to her work and lives each day as if it were her last, and for this reason she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will help her to buy products like sweets, basic grains, beverages, bread, instant soups and other items. This is how Mirna will reach her goal, which is to see her business grow. She has every confidence that if this happens she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweets, basic grains, beverages, bread, and instant soups.

loans.name: Dominga Concepción

texts.es: Dominga Concepción D. treinta años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y su hijo quien asiste a la escuela. Ella posee una  venta D. ropa y cosméticos en el lugar D. su residencia; últimamente su negocio ha sido más visitado por las  personas del lugar pues Dominga ofrece un servicio excelente y su mercadería la venD. a un buen precio, es una mujer muy entregada a su trabajo y piensa que su motivación D. salir adelante es la que la impulsa a sobresalir; ella quiere mantenerse a la cabeza D. su competencia es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le dé la oportunidad D. comprar más mercadería ropa para dama y caballero, cosméticos y perfumes. Dominga tiene la esperanza que su trabajo le dará grandes frutos que le permitirán darle a su familia una vida plena con seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Dominga Concepcíon is thirty years old and lives with her life companion and her child who goes to school. She sells clothes and cosmetics from her home. Her neighbors frequently visit her business as she offers excellent service and sells the merchandise for a good price. She is devoted to her work and her desire to progress pushes her to succeed. 
In order to keep up with the competition she is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL. This loan will proviD. her with the opportunity to buy women’s and men’s clothes, cosmetics and perfumes. Dominga hopes that her work will give her great benefits such as allowing her to give her family a full life with economic security.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics and perfume.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción vive con su compañero de vida y su hija en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de ropa en el lugar de su residencia con la mantiene su hogar, la gente la visita porque vende prendas de todo tipo y sobre todo novedosas para damas, caballeros y niños su clientela la prefiere porque tiene siempre lo que necesitan, a precios accesibles y con un excelente servicio. Concepción piensa  que solo aquel que está a la vanguardia es aquel que puede hacer realidad sus sueños, es por eso que siempre está adelante de la competencia y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más prendas como vestidos, pantalones, faldas, camisas, blusas entre otros. De esta forma siempre tendrá que ofrecerles a sus clientes y Concepción tendrá la oportunidad de darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Concepción lives with her life partner and her daughter in their own house. She sells clothes from her home. People visit her home in order to buy all types of items, mostly novelties for women, men and children. Her customers like her business because she always has what they need, at reasonable prices and with excellent service Concepción thinks that only the newest styles are the ones that will reach the dreams of her customers. It is for this reason that she is always ahead of the competition and also is why she is asking for this loan from INTEGRAL. This loan will allow her to buy more items such as dresses, pants, skirts and blouses among other things. In this way she always has something new to offer her customers. She also will have the opportunity to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy dresses, pants, skirts, shirts and blouses.

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es: José Miguel  de sesenta y uno años de edad vive con su compañera de vida en casa propia. El posee una venta de huevos desde hace varios años y es muy conocido por las personas de la localidad, sus clientes lo prefieren porque vende huevos frescos y de muy buena calidad además a un buen precio; ademas es muy carismático siempre recibe a la clientela muy contento y los atiende como se merecen; José es un hombre emprendedor, para él solo se triunfa en el mundo si no  se dejan los sueños de lado es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar huevos para mantener a flote el negocio. José tiene la confianza que esto le permitirá sostener a su familia y llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: José Miguel is 71 years old and lives with his life partner in their own house. He has been selling eggs for many years. He is well known in his neighborhood. His clients prefer his eggs as they are fresh and of good quality and sold at a good price. He is also very charismatic. He always is happy to attend his customers and he helps them, as they deserve to be helped. José is an enterprising man and he has succeeded in the world without leaving his dreams behind. This is why he is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL. This loan will allow him to buy eggs in order to maintain his business. This will allow him to support his family and bring economic security to his home.

loans.use: to buy eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new stock of second hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Eulalio

texts.es: Eulalio de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijas en casa propia. El posee ganado con el que se dedica a la venta de leche y además cultiva maíz, ya posee mucha clientela surte leche a varios negocios del lugar y vende maíz a un buen precio. Eulalio es un hombre dedicado a su trabajo siempre se encuentra muy activo, él piensa que con pequeñas cosas logrará realizar grandes metas en su vida. Eulalio necesita mantener muy bien alimentado su ganado para poder mantener su negocio, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar concentrado para el ganado. Eulalio tiene la esperanza que con su negocio lograra mantener a flote la economía de su hogar y lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Eulalio, forty four, lives with his common-law wife and their daughters in their own home.  He owns cows and he sells the milk and also grows corn.  He has many business customers to whom he supplies milk, and he sells the corn for a good price.  Eulalio is dedicated to his work and is always very active.  He thinks that one can achieve big goals in life with little things.  Eulalio needs to keep his cows well fed so that he the business will continue, and that is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL.  He will use the loan to buy concentrated feed for the cattle. He hopes that his business will keep supporting his home and succeed in giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy concentrated cattle feed

loans.name: Rosa Aydee

texts.es: Rosa Aydee vive con su compañero de vida y sus  tres hijos los cuales asisten a una escuela cerca de la localidad donde residen. Ella posee una venta de artículos de uso personal, y su venta es muy conocida en el lugar pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad y  tienen precios accesibles, además los clientes la prefieren porque les ofrece un buen servicio, siempre esta alegre y los atiende con gran amabilidad; Rosa es una mujer que quiere superarse para ella la manera en la que atrae y motiva a las personas a comprar sus productos es lo que definirá su éxito; esto la impulsa a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos como shampo, cremas, desodorantes, cosméticos, perfumes, calcetines entre otros. Con esto Rosa siempre mantendrá mercancía para lo que sus clientes necesiten y tiene fe que los frutos de su negocio le darán la oportunidad de darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Rosa Aydee lives with her life partner and three children who attend school close to their home. She has a shop where she sells personal items and her business is well known since she sells high quality products with reasonable prices. In addition, clients prefer her because she offers them great service. She is always cheerful and attends to them kindly. Rosa is a woman who wants to succeed in life. Her ability to attract clients and motivate them to buy her products are what she considers to be her success. This motivates her to request INTEGRAL a loan to buy products such as shampoo, creams, deoderants, cosmetics, perfumes, socks, etc. With the loan Rosa will always be able to have products available for her clients and she has faith that the profits she makes from this business will give her opportunities to offer her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy products such as shampoo, creams, deoderants, cosmetics, perfumes, socks, etc.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a 36-year-old, technology-savvy lady from Western Kenya. She is married to Mr Juma, a driver, and they have 5 children. 

Everline operates a computer service business which involves photocopying, scanning and printing within Siaya. She has done this business for the last year and is able to make a monthly income of around  20,000 KES. A need for financial services arose, so she joined KADET LTD whereby she has qualified for a first loan of 19,000 KES, which she will use to buy photocopying paper, a scanner and a printer.

From the anticipated profits she intends to buy more computers, since her dream is to open a big cybercafé offering internet services. She is now looking for a Kiva lender to help her realize this dream.

loans.use: to buy stationery, a scanner and a printer

loans.name: Angélica Marilyn

texts.es: Angélica Marilyn de 28 años de edad, habita en casa familiar con su madre y  su pequeña hija. Angélica es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. Hace algunos años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en el mercado municipal de la zona donde ella habita. El negocio consiste en una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de varios años. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para Angélica lo más importante son los clientes, siempre los atiende con una sonrisa y mucha amabilidad razón por la cual se ha ganado la confianza de muchos en la zona y a demás porque siempre tiene lo que los clientes buscan. Angélica sueña con dar a su hija una mejor calidad de vida y sabe que la única fuente de ingresos es su pequeño negocio, por tanto no puede descuidarse de  el y lucha por mantenerlo activo. Es por esta razón que se motivo en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su tiendita y abastecerla con todo tipo de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente, y de más productos que permitan atraer a mas clientes. Con la fe puesta en Dios que de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Angélica Marilyn, 28, lives in the family home with her mother and small daughter.  Angélica is an enterprising, tenacious woman.  A few years ago she decided to set up a small business in the municipal market in her neighborhood.  The business consists of a small store that with much effort and dedication she’s managed to keep throughout several years.  She has quite a few customers because they are the most important thing for Angélica, she always tends to them with a smile and much kindness which has led to her winning over the trust of many in her area and also because she stocks what they are looking for.

Angélica dreams with providing her daughter with a better quality of life and realizes that her only source of income is the small store so she must not neglect it and she struggles to keep it active.  This is the reason behind her loan request to INTEGRAL.  She wants to invest in her little store and stock it with all sorts of products like; rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, snacks, oil, paper, detergent and other products that will cause her to attract more customers.  With her faith placed in God she is sure that she’ll reach her goal this way.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia prepares rice for sale in the early hours of the morning in Ayensudo, a village near Elmina. She displays fruits on a table for sale as well. She has been in this business for 2 years. Felicia has been through junior high school. She has a child. Her husband is a teacher. She assists her husband in paying the household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy oranges, watermelon, pineapple and other types of fruits to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: to buy oranges, watermelon, pineapple and other types of fruits to sell

loans.name: María

texts.es: María, D. 64 años D. edad vive en casa propia con su esposo. Durante mucho tiempo María se ha dedicado a la venta D. diferentes tipos D. vitaminas y medicamentos que con mucho amor comercializa D. manera ambulante en diferentes zonas cercanas a su lugar D. residencia. A pesar D. ser una mujer D. edad avanzada no se da por vencida, es una mujer llena D. energía, carisma y espíritu. Gracias a su dedicación y amabilidad en su trabajo ha logrado ganarse la confianza D. muchas personas y por el momento son muchos los clientes que solicitan sus productos. Esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  para poder comprar variedad D. medicamentos como vitaminas para el cerebro, tanto para niños como para adultos, y diferentes tipos D. medicamentos que son demandados por los clientes. Con esto espera poder mejorar sus ventas y por enD. sus ingresos para poder gozar D. una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
María, 64, lives with her husband in her own house.  For a long time María has been a street vendor of various types of vitamins and medicines that she lovingly sells throughout various areas near her home.  Despite being a woman of advanced age, she is not defeated.  She is a woman that is full of energy, charisma and spirit.  Thanks to her dedication and kindness at work she’s managed to secure the trust of many people and for the moment has many customers that request her products.

This has led her to take make the decision of asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy a variety of medicines, like vitamins for the brain for children as well as for adults, and different kinds of medicines that customers demand.  She hopes to improve sales this way and as a result improve her income and to be able to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy various medicines.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is a single parent taking care of a child. She has received a senior high education. Kate sells fruits, plastic cups, trays and bowls at Elmina, which she has done for 3 years. She wants to increase the sale of plastic containers, so she needs a loan to buy more plastic cups, trays and bowls to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Kate plans to save towards her child’s education and to reinvest back into the business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy more plastic cups, trays and bowls to sell

loans.name: Nelson Ernesto

texts.es: Nelson  Ernesto de 40 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su esposa y dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Para Nelson la Familia lo es todo y día a día lucha por darles lo mejor. Durante toda su vida ha trabajado duramente en una pequeña carpintería que con mucho esfuerzo  ha logrado instalar en su casa  de  habitación.  Sus productos son muy demandados por que para él lo más importante es que los clientes estén satisfechos con el producto que solicitan, por tanto Nelson  se esmera por dar un producto de buena calidad y de dar la atención que el cliente se merece. Últimamente ha notado un pequeño aumento en la demanda de sus productos  y como todo hombre emprendedor no quiere dejar pasar la oportunidad, ha decidido solicitar este crédito para poder cubrir esa demanda que cada día es más grande. Con el crédito piensa comprar variedad de madera, clavos,  hierro y las herramientas necesarias para poder trabajar en los productos que el elabora. Con todo esto espera aumentar  el nivel de ventas que le permitan obtener mayores ingresos y con esto ´poder aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nelson Ernesto, 40, lives in his own house with his wife and two children who are in school.  For Nelson, the family is everything and he struggles daily to provide them with the best.  All his life he’s worked hard in a small carpentry shop that he was able to set up at home with much effort.  His products are in high demand and it is very important to him that his customers are satisfied.  Because of this, Nelson strives to provide a good quality product and provide the customers with the kind of service he deserves.  He has noted a small rise in demand recently and, like all enterprising men, does not want this opportunity to go to waste so has decided to request this loan to cover demand which grows daily.

He plans to use the loan to buy wood, nails, metal and the tools needed to work on the products he manufactures.  He hopes all this will help him increase sales levels that will lead to high income and thus hope for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy assorted lumber, nails, metal and tools.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is married and has two children.  She sells Fante kenkey, fermented corn dough wrapped in banana leaves, at Elmina. Augustina has a junior high education. Her husband is a driver. She  assists her husband in paying the household expenses and educating their children. Her loan will be used to buy maize in sacks to cook to sell. She hopes to use the profits from her business to save to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase maize to cook.

loans.name: Delmy Aracely

texts.es: Delmy Aracely, de 49 años de edad, habita en casa propia con sus  hijos los cuales son todo para ella. Delmy  ha trabajado toda su vida para dar a su familia el pan de cada día que con gran sacrificio se gana. Ella posee una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de habitación, en la que ofrece diversidad de productos como: azúcar, frijoles, arroz, aderezos, galletas, condimentos, café, entre otros. Este lugar goza de mucha accesibilidad y prestigio ya que Doña Delmy se esmera por atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera cada vez que solicitan sus productos. Ella sueña con poder surtir su negocio para poder ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos. Esto la ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder abastecer su tienda con variedad de: frijoles, arroz, golosinas, cereales, verduras, bebidas, café, leche y de mas productos que son atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera espera obtener mayores ventas y por ende mayores ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Delmy Aracely, 49, lives in her own house with her children who are everything to her.  Delmy has worked her entire life to provide daily sustenance for her family; she earns it with much sacrifice.  She has a small store at home where she stocks a variety of products like: sugar, beans, rice, dressings, cookies, condiments and coffee, among others.  The store enjoys much accessibility and prestige because Delmy takes great pains to tend to her customers in the best way possible each time they request her products.  She dreams with being able to stock the store to provide even more variety of products to her customers.

This has pushed her to request a loan from INTEGRAL to stock the store with a variety of products like: beans, rice, snacks, cereals, vegetables, beverages, coffee, milk and other products that are attractive to customers.  She hopes to increase sales and as a result earn higher income that will help her improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: For the past three years Mary has been baking at Elmina. She is a single parent and has two children.  She wants to increase the number of items she bakes for sale. She is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, essence, firewood and other items needed to bake bread, pies, and rock-buns. She hopes to use the profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, essence, firewood, and other items needed to bake bread, pies, and rock-buns to sell.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es: Fidelina de 44 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su hija que ya es mayor de edad.  Como toda mujer emprendedora tiene su propio negocio de costura en el lugar donde habita que con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado establecer. Tiene muchos  años de experiencia en la costura y diseña cualquier tipo de prenda de vestir que los clientes soliciten tales como faldas, vestidos, pantalones, uniformes, etc. Este negocio ha sido para Fidelina su principal fuente de ingreso y sigue confiando que así seguirá siendo. En este negocio lo  más importante es dejar satisfecho al cliente de esta manera Doña Fidelina  se ha ganado la confianza de los habitantes de la zona que cada día la prefieren mas. Esta señora llena de sueños solicita este crédito para poder invertir en material para costura como: hilo, tela, elástico, botones, etc. Que le permitan ofrecer mayor cantidad y variedad de sus estilos de ropa. Y aspirar a mejores ventas e ingresos para poder cubrir sus necesidades y vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Fidelina, 44, lives in her own house with her daughter who is already an adult.  Like all enterprising women she has a business of her own.  She has a dressmaking shop at home that she’s established with much effort.  She has many years experience in dressmaking and she can design any type of item of clothing that the customers request like skirts, dresses, pants, uniforms, etc.  This business has been Fidelina’s main source of income and she trusts that it will continue to be so.

In this business what’s most important is to satisfy the customer and Fidelina has won over the trust of residents in her area who every day prefer her more.  She is full of dreams and is asking for this loan to buy dressmaking supplies like: thread, fabric, elastic, buttons, etc. that will make it possible for her to offer greater quantity and variety of styles of clothing and to aspire to better sales and income to cover her needs and to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, elastic, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Adjwoa

texts.en: Adjwoa  is married and has four children.  She makes Fante kenkey, fermented corn dough wrapped in banana leaves. She is also a fish monger at Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. Her husband is a farmer. Adjwoa uses her income to assist her husband in paying the household expenses. Adjwoa will use the loan to purchase additional bags of maize to produce kenkey for sale.  She wishes to reinvest the profit back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of maize to produce kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is married and has three children.  She sells watermelon and is also a hairdresser. Her husband is a driver. As a way of supporting her husband, she provides the basic needs of her family. Hannah is requesting a loan to purchase watermelon, oranges, and other types of fruits. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to revive her hairdressing business.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon, oranges, and other types of fruits.

loans.name: Tuichiboi

texts.en:
Tuichiboi is busy husband who has a secondary education. His wife is a hardworking woman and helps in her husband’s in his farming business, which involves growing potatoes and wheat. He has been a farmer for 11 years and has earned enough money to provide for his family but would like to increase his income by producing a larger harvest. To make this possible, he has applied for a loan for 3,500 TJS to buy fertilizer. He hopes to earn enough money to buy a car for his family. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being the home of a key post along the Silk Road and the place where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Kyeizinga Womens Group

texts.en:
Prisca is 44 years old  and has five children. She is in the business of agriculture in Ntungamo and has been in this business for over 10 years. Earnings from her agriculture business have been a tower of support for her and her family. She grows a variety of cash crops, including bananas, cassava, maize, and rice, which she sells at the numerous food markets in Ntungamo. 

To compete favorably in this business, Prisca has been constantly applying high grade manure at her farm resulting in sturdy yields and harvests from her farm. Her weekly profits total up to 50,000 shillings. Prisca is requesting a loan to purchase more high grade manure for her farms and also to pay fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase high grade manure and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Kodzovi

texts.fr: Père de 01 enfant, Kodzovi (il a porté une chemise blanche sur la photo) est marié à une revendeuse. En 2007, il a commencé par vendre des friperies (habits importés de l’étranger). Il veut renforcer son activité dans la vente des habits c’est pour cela il sollicite ce prêt. Il achète au marché de HEDZRANAWOE et revend dans sa boutique.
texts.en: Father of one child, Kodzovi (wearing a white shirt in the photo) is married to a reseller.  In 2007, he began selling used clothing imported from abroad.  He is requesting this loan because he would like to grow his clothing business.  He buys his products in the Hedzranawoe market and resells them in his store.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Yesenia Lissette

texts.es: Yesenia Lissette, de 31 años de edad, habita en casa familiar con sus padres y dos hermanos. Yesenia se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. Como toda mujer emprendedora ha hecho de su casa un negocio y desde hace mucho tiempo que ha trabajado duramente en la costura y cada día los clientes la prefieren mas  por ser una mujer dedicada en su trabajo, ofrecer buenos precios, calidad y por siempre satisfacer las necesidades de estos.  Ella elabora cualquier tipo de prenda de vestir y siempre trata de estar al día con los estilos y nuevos modelos de ropa. Doña Yesenia tiene muchos sueños y uno de ellos es ver su negocio florecer. Todo esto la ha impulsado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con la esperanza de que de esta manera va mejorar su situación y lograra alcanzar su sueño. El crédito lo quiere para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima  como: variedad de telas, hilos, botones, zíper, entre otros. Con la fe puesta en Dios que lograra su objetivo.
texts.en:
Yesenia Lissett, 31, lives in the family home with her parents and two siblings.  Yesenia manufactures articles of clothing to sell.  Like all enterprising women she’s turned her home into a business and has worked hard for a long time sewing; every day customers prefer her more because she’s a woman that’s devoted to her work, who offers good prices and quality, and who always strives to satisfy customer needs.  She will make any type of article of clothing and always tries to be up-to-date with the latest styles and new models of clothing.  Yesenia has many dreams and one of them is to flourish.

All this has encouraged her to request a loan from INTEGRAL with the hope that this way will improve her situation and she will reach her dream.  The loan will be used to buy raw materials like: a variety of fabrics, thread, buttons and zippers, among others.  With her faith placed in God she knows she’ll reach her objective.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like: an assortment of fabric, thread, buttons and zippers, among others.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn makes a living baking pastries, bread and sweets in the village of Ayensudo, which is located near the larger town of Elmina. She is a high school graduate, married and has four children. Her husband is a pastor and she helps him take care of their home. She will use her loan to buy flour, sugar, turmeric and other ingredients she needs for her baking. She hopes to use the new profits to provide a meaningful education to her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for a bakery.

loans.name: Ana Mirna

texts.es: Ana  Mirna de 43 años de edad, reside en casa familiar con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos. Ana es una mujer increíble, trabajadora y sobre todo admirable. Desde hace mucho tiempo que trabaja duramente para contribuir en la economía de la familia. Tiene una pequeña tienda en la cual vende todo tipo de producto de primera necesidad y algunas prendas de vestir. Además  de esto también cuenta con un negocio de pupusas en su lugar de habitación. Gracias a la aceptación por parte de los clientes Ana ha logrado establecer estos negocios y además se encuentra ubicada en una zona estratégica en la cual no tiene mucha competencia, se podría decir que es uno de los negocios líderes de  la zona. Y como toda mujer emprendedora solicita este crédito a  INTEGRAL para seguir surtiendo su negocio con el objetivo de mantenerlo vivo para que siga dando los frutos que hasta el momento ha dado. Con este crédito espera surtir su negocio con variedad de productos como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, bebidas, café, aceite, detergente, jabón, prendas de vestir,  etc. Y de esta manera lograr mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Mirna, 43, lives in the family home with her life companion and their three children.  Ana is an incredible, hard working but, above all, admirable woman.  She has worked hard for a long time to contribute to the family economy.  She has a small store where she sells all sorts of basic need items and some articles of clothing.  Thanks to the good reception she’s had from customers, Ana has managed to establish the businesses.  Besides, she’s located in a strategic spot where she does not have much competition.  One could say she’s a business leader in the neighborhood.

Like all enterprising women she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to continue to stock her store with the goal in mind to keep it alive so that it will continue to bear fruit like it’s been doing so far.  She hopes to use this loan to stock the store with a variety of products like: beans, rice, sugar, snacks, beverages, coffee, oil, detergent, soap, articles of clothing, etc. to attain a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 32 years old, married and has two children who are 2 and 5 years old. Her older child is in school and she makes a living by running a cafeteria. She has become an effective business manager thanks to training sessions provided by Faulu Kenya. In about five years, Beatrice hopes to own a large hotel. She is applying for a loan for 20,000 Kes to buy a refrigerator, blender and potatoes, which she uses to make chips.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, blender and potatoes to make into chips.

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en: Adiza makes a living selling whole watermelons and watermelon pieces. She also sells rice and soap in the town of Elmina, where she lives with her two children and her husband, who makes a living as a trader. As a way of reducing the financial burden on her husband, she is educating her own children. She will use this loan to buy more watermelons, oranges and other types of fruit to sell to her customers. She plans to reinvest the additional money she earns in her business.

loans.use: to buy watermelons, oranges and other fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Toirjon

texts.en:
Toirjon lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He is married and the very-devoted father of two children. For the last eight years, he has made a living as a farmer. He works with his wife, and sells his produce in local markets. Toirjon is applying for a loan for 10,500 TJS to buy fertilizer, fuel and lubricants. He is committed to increase his profits, buy a home in town and provide his children with a good life. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being the home of a key post along the Silk Road and the place where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.en:
Bahriniso is married and has one child. She sells fabrics for sewing national women dresses at the central market in the city of Penjikent. She has been in this business for 10 years. Bahriniso is very persistent, disciplined, and creative. All these traits help her to succeed in her business. Bahriniso's place is located at a good spot at the market and she always has many customers. Bahriniso is requesting a loan for $3,000 to increase her assortment of goods for sale. She works hard to develop her business. Bahriniso's goal is to be a successful and independent person, able to provide for her family, and help others.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.
