These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is a widow taking care of five dependents. She makes banku and kenkey (kenkey for distribution to retailers) at Elmina.  She has done this for 20 years.  Adjoa uses her income to see to the well-being of her home. 

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize to produce kenkey and banku for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to invest in her business. She is in this picture mixing the dough to be used for the banku.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize to produce kenkey and banku for sale.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri comes from village Tkhilnari, West Georgia. He is 40 years old, married and lives with his family – his wife Shorena, their 10-year-old daughter and his parents. Badri works as a night-watchmen in a local stone factory and TV station. He gets a salary for his job. Besides the above-mentioned, Badri and Shorena earn income from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 0.5 ha of agricultural land, where various fruits and vegetables are grown. Harvested products are sold locally to retailers. 

Also they have a milk cow and sell cheese. Along with all that, Badri has 60 bee-hives with bee-colonies. Twice a year they get honey from the beehives and sell it on the local market. The total monthly income of the family is approximately 2,000 Laris. 

With the requested credit, Badri will purchase additional bee-hives and bee-colonies. He will get more honey and sell it on the local market. This will positively impact the income of the family. The increase in income will be used for financing their child’s education.

loans.use: to purchase bee-hives and bee-colonies.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is sitting close to a bowl of fried fish, a gallon of oil, and a pan of uncooked rice. She cooks food such as rice with tomato sauce at Ayensudo, a village in Elmina.  She is married to a farmer and together they live with their four children. Her husband is a farmer. She plays a part in the education of her children by buying books for them.

A loan from Kiva will be used to buy a bag of rice, a carton of fish, canned tomatoes and other ingredients to prepare the rice for sale.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a bag of rice, a carton of fish, canned tomatoes and other ingredients to prepare the rice for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary retails in frozen fish, meat, sausages, chicken and gizzards at Elmina. She has a child and has been in this business for 7 years. She wishes to increase the quantity of frozen items mentioned earlier and so needs a loan to be able to buy more frozen items for resale.  She plans to add another refrigerator to the current one.

loans.use: to buy more frozen items for resale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells tomatoes, oranges, watermelons and pineapple at Elmina. a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer.  Ekua has been selling tomatoes, oranges and pineapple for 2 years. She assists her husband in paying the household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more fruits for resale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building an awning where she can sell the fruits.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for resale.

loans.name: Ameyo Dodzi

texts.fr: Femme dynamique de 56ans, Améyo est mère de 03 enfants. Son mari est retraité. C’est une ancienne cliente de WAGES et na pas de difficulté à payer ses crédits. Son cinquième prêt lui servira à acheter des produits de premières nécessités (riz, sucre, mayonnaise, huile végétale) vue qu’elle n’a plus assez de stock pour revendre à la population de Baguida et ses environs. Elle s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé et est dans cette activité il ya 20ans.
texts.en: A dynamic woman of 56, Améyo is the mother of three children. Her husband is retired. She has been a client of WAGES for a long time and has had no difficulty repaying her loans. Her fifth loan will serve to buy staple goods (rice, sugar, mayonnaise, vegetable oil)  since she no longer has enough stock to sell to the people of Baguida and its surrounding areas. She buys her supplies at the Grand market of Lomé and she has been in this business for 20 years.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is dedicated to the agriculture and livestock industry.  He cultivates livestock at his home where he lives with his family, made up of his wife and three children. Ahmad has always taken care to protect his crops through fumigation in order obtain a good harvest.  Ahmad needs to purchase cows to raise and to obtain milk for sustenance and for commercialization.  He seeks support from IMON International for a loan that will allow him to succeed in his business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason.

For the past twenty years Theresa has been selling fruit in Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast within the central region of Ghana. With the profits from her sales, she helps to pay the utility bills.

Theresa’s loan will be used to buy watermelon, pineapple and other fruits to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy watermelon, pineapple and other fruits to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer.

Cecilia sells fresh fruits and vegetables such as pineapples, watermelons, tomatoes, plantains, cassava, yams, sweet potatoes, coco-yams and others at Elmina, where she has done so for three years. She uses her income to help her husband pay for household expenses.

Cecilia will use her loan to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale. With the profits from her sales, she plans build a kiosk from which to sell her produce.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Revendeuse ambulante de bijoux depuis 2009, Akuvi est mariée à un frigoriste et ils ont 01 enfant. Sa passion c’est de rendre belle toutes personnes et ce prêt lui servira à acheter de nouveaux bijoux pour pouvoir accroitre son stock qu’elle a l’habitude d’acheter au Bénin et à Lomé. Elle veut avoir sa propre boutique pour mieux s’installer et répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: A strolling costume jewelry seller since 2009, Akuvi is married to a specialist in cooling and they have one child. Akuvi's passion is to make everyone pretty and this loan allow her to buy more jewelry to add to her stock which she customarily purchases in Bénin and in Lomé. She wants to have her own little boutique so that she can settle in and respond to the ever-growing demand for her wares.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. 

For the past three years Araba has been selling slippers and shoes in Elmina. She sells fruits as well. She responsibly helps to pay the family’s utility bills. 

Araba’s loan will be used to buy different types of slippers and shoes for resale. She hopes to save the profits from her business toward buying her own shop.

loans.use: to buy different types of slippers and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba sells pineapple, bags of charcoal and other items at Elmina. She is divorced and has three children. Araba has been selling pineapples for 10 years. She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of charcoal to supply her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a tent covering for her charcoal.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to supply her customers.

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena is married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. She has received junior high education. Mena sells plastic bowls, trays, cups, ladles and other items as a peddler at Elmina.  Mena uses he income to help her husband to take care of the home. She will use the loan to purchase plastic bowls for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mena plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bowls for resale.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi comes from village Dandalo, in mountainous Adjara, in the western part of the country. He is a  23-year-old farmer and lives with his parents, elder sister and grandparents. Giorgi’s father works as night-watchman in a local school; his mother is a housewife. His sister is a teacher in the same school. His grandparents are retired. 

Giorgi is heading up the family farm. He runs a small dairy farm consisting of two milk cows. His mother produces traditional Georgian cheese, which is sold on the local market. Along with the above-mentioned, Giorgi grows vegetables and grapes on 1 ha. of land owned by the family. Vegetables are sold to retailers locally and grapes are used for wine-making. Wine is sold locally to the villagers. 

With the requested credit Giorgi plans to expand the vineyard, through planting additional grape vines. He will be able to produce more wine and sell it on the local market as there is quite a big demand for his wine in the village. 

Part of the profit will be reinvested in the business and another part will be saved for house renovation, in order to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase young grape vines and pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is an enterprising 53 year-old mother from the County of Kisumu, along the shores of Lake Victoria. She is married to Douglas, who operates a motor vehicle mechanic business in Kisumu town. They have three grown children.

Annah operates a second-hand clothes business in Kibuye market, a busy open air market in the county of Kisumu.  She has been in this business for the last ten years and makes a monthly income of Kshs 20,000. She joined KADET LTD and is taking her first loan of Kshs 60,000.   She will use it to buy new stock of second-hand clothing for resale. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to open another clothing stall within the city of Kisumu, and she dreams of one day becoming a leading supplier of second hand clothing to other small scale traders. At the moment, she is looking for a Kiva lender to help her realize this dream.

loans.use: to buy new stock of used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Magdan

texts.en:
Magdan is a 35-year-old farmer from village Dzevri, Imereti Region, West Georgia. She is married and lives with her husband Temur, her parents and two sons – 8-year-old Luka and 7-year-old Saba. Both children go to school. Magdan, Temur and Magdan’s father are involved in family agricultural activities. Magdan’s mother works as a waitress in a local pub. 

The family has a milk cow. Magdan produces cheese and sells weekly 5-6 kilos of it on the local open market. Also they have a vineyard with 950 grape vines. 500 kg of grapes and 600 liters of wine are sold during the season each year. Along with the above-mentioned, they grow potatoes and onions on a family-owned 0.12 ha. plot of land. Approximately 1.5 tons of harvested vegetables are sold on the local open market by Magdan, along with the cheese. 

With the requested credit Magdan plans to start renovation of their house. In particular she will purchase materials for kitchen renovation and pay the workers. That will improve the living conditions of the family. In the future Magdan will put aside some savings from the family’s income to renovate the rest of the house.

loans.use: to purchase renovation materials for their kitchen and pay the workers.

loans.name: Kyamwasha Bakyara Kwebisaho Group

texts.en: Twenty-six year-old Cornelious has been selling bricks for the last 10 years in Ntungamo.  Cornelious is also a builder and he says he entered this business to supplement his income. His hard work has been paying off, as manifested in the increasing demand for his bricks. The early years were a bit stagnant, but the business started growing by leaps and bounds after a period of 3 years. He says this business generates him 450,000 shillings monthly as profit. He says he is going to use this loan to purchase better brick-making machines.

loans.use: to purchase better brick-making machines

loans.name: Ala'a

texts.en: Ala'a is a 24 year old single man from Al Ashrafieh, Jordan. Years ago, Ala'a started his spice business by peddling his products on the street.  Now Ala'a has his own shop. Ala'a is requesting a loan of 1350JD to expand his shop and purchase more products. Ala'a aspires to open a second shop.

loans.use: to expand his shop and purchase more products

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 53 year old widow and the mother of 7 children.  She lives in A. Ashrafieh, Jordan. Years ago, Mariam started a business from home, selling groceries. After years of hard work and unwavering determination, Mariam succeeded in obtaining a license and opening her own grocery store. Mariam is requesting a loan of 2000JD to purchase more products for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her store

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 27 year-old married man and the father of one child, from Al Ashrafia, Jordan. Ahmad has a vehicle repair shop.  He is requesting a loan of 1500JD to purchase more tools and equipment to improve his performance as a mechanic and to be more efficient for his customers. Ahmad aspires to enlarge his business, increase his customer base, and improve the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more tools and equipment

loans.name: Ryad

texts.en: Ryad is a 40 year-old married man with five children, from Sahab, Jordan. Ryad owns a grocery store and he would like to offer his customers more variety and healthy snack food choices for their children. Being the father of five children, Ryad believes in teaching children healthy eating habits to carry them into adulthood with a better quality of life and health. Ryad also knows that the summer months in Jordan can be very hot and challenging for young people. So, Ryad is requesting a loan of 1500JD to expand his selection of fresh fruits, fruit juices, fruit-flavored yogurts and sugar-free ice cream treats. Ryad aspires to expand his customer-base by incorporating a sense of sociA. responsibility into his business and treating his community with respect. Ryad also would like to increase his family income, improve their living conditions and give his children better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is a 31-year-old married man, the father of two children and is from Al Zarqa, Jordan.

Iyad is a carpenter who is requesting a loan of 2,000 JOD to purchase materials for his carpentry business. He has several goals, including increasing his customer base and the geographic scope of his business. He is also planning to buy a new house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-year-old married man from Amman, Jordan, who owns an electronics equipment store.

Ahmad is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to purchase more products for his store. He is planning to open a second store, increase his sales, and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more electronics equipment for his store.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 30-year-old single man from Amman, Jordan, who owns a coffee shop.

Mohammad is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to expand his business. He aspires to improve his family’s standard of living by moving his shop to a larger location.

loans.use: to move his shop to a larger location.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products

loans.name: Nida'a

texts.en: Nida'a is a 40-year-old married woman from Amman, Jordan. She is a tailor. Nida'a is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase materiA. to make more clothes and to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase material to make clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wedding dresses and equipment to improve her business.

loans.name: Hazvidi Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 34-year-old Gladys (holding the yellow folder) from Masvingo. She is married with five children aged 4, 8, 9, 12 and 14. Three of her children attend school.  Gladys has operated a retail business selling clothes and footwear at the rail station flea market for 5 years. She says the main challenge she faces is competition from other sellers. Gladys has requested a loan of $400 to purchase clothing and footwear stock. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send her children to school. In the future, Gladys plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and footwear stock.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr: Cette dame est résidente dans une communauté rurale , une zone très enclavée et difficile pour le déplacement. Connaissant les besoins de la population  de son fief elle décide depuis 2 ans à installer une alimentation générale dans le but d'écouler quelques denrées alimentaires dont sa population a besoin. Ainsi, elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer sa boutique alimentaire en s'approvisionnant pour 10 sacs de riz,50 litres d'huile et 50 kilos de sucre qui sont des produits souvent en rupture dans sa localité. Les bénéfices seront destinés à soutenir son mari cultivateur ainsi qu'a l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: This lady lives in a rural community, an area that is cut off and where it is difficult to get around. Knowledgeable about the needs of people in her fiefdom, she decided two years ago to open up a general store in order to sell some foodstuffs that local people need. So she is requesting this loan to bolster her business, by buying 10 sacs of rice, 50 liters of oil, 50 kilos of sugar. All these products are difficult to obtain in her area. The profit will be used to help out her husband who is a farmer and to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: COMMERCE

loans.name: Areej

texts.en: Areej is a 32-year-old married woman and mother of three children who lives in Madaba, Jordan. She is a tailor who owns her own shop. Areej is requesting a loan of 1,600 JOD to purchase material for making clothes and better display equipment to improve her product presentation. This loan will help Areej expand her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase material and better display equipment.

loans.name: Kitinda Traders Group

texts.en: Forty-two-year-old Dominic is happily married with four kids. They are a happy-go-lucky family and love to get together for reunions, especially on the weekends. To support his family, Dominic relies on income from his pub business in Ntungamo. At his pub, he sells a variety of both hard and soft beverages. This means he needs to restock to be able to meet the demands of patrons who frequent his pub. At times, though, he is so inundated by the demand of his clients that he runs short on supplies. That means he has to dig deep into his profit reserves to restock. He reckons this loan will come in really handy. Formerly, Dominic had a hand in an agro sales business. This hardworking man says his business generates 200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) weekly. He says with this loan he is going to purchase more crates of both hard and soft drinks to resell at his pub.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of both hard and soft beverages to resell at his pub

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 31-year-old married man from Amman, Jordan, and the father of two children. Mohammad owns a barbershop, and he is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars (JOD) to purchase new equipment and perform maintenance on his used equipment. Mohammad also hopes to renovate his barbershop and update the décor.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and perform maintenance on his used equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her product selection

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 30 years old.  She has 4 children between 2 and 9 years old. She owns a shop in which she sells cooking oil, sugar, salt and rice. She has been running this business for 7 years and her business is doing well. This business has enabled her to pay for her children’s schooling as well as feed her family.  Claudine is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell in her shop, such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc. With the profits generated, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 51-year-old married man and the father of five children from Al Ashrafieh, Jordan.

Yousef owns a carpentry business. He is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to purchase more equipment for production. Yousef aspires to enlarge his business.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for production.

loans.name: Teophile

texts.en:
Teophile is 45 years old and has four children aged four to twenty-one years old.

For the past four years Teophile has been rearing animals such as goats to sell, as well as selling eggs and sorghum. It has enabled her to feed and educate her children.

Teophile is requesting a loan to buy more goats and chickens. She plans to pay school fees for her children with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy goats and chickens.

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar comes from village Nakhshirghele, Imereti Region, West Georgia. He is 46 years old, married and lives with his wife Marina, his mother and his 8-month-old son. 

The main source of income for the family is selling wine. Otar purchases wine locally and sells it in Samegrelo Region. He earns approximately 400 Laris per month. He started this business three years ago and gained quite good experience. He finds it more profitable to produce wine in his cellar and sell it on the same market, where he already has business contacts, as well as customers. 

The family also owns three milk cows, whose dairy products are sold in the village. 

With the requested credit Otar will renovate his cellar and all equipment needed for wine production. His profit will increase when he switches to selling his own wine. Part of the income received by Otar will be saved and used for cultivation (planting) of the vineyard. Production of wine from his own grapes will increase his future income even more.

loans.use: to purchase materials to renovate the cellar where he makes wine.

loans.name: No'aman

texts.en:
No'aman is a 37-year-old single man from Marka, Jordan.

No'aman owns a shop that sells handmade products. He started his business from his house, and with a sense of ambition and very hard work, he established a separate shop outside of his home.

No'aman is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to purchase products for his shop. He has set his sights on increasing his family’s income along with his market share.

loans.use: to purchase products for his shop.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie is 45 years old and married. She has seven children who are aged eight to twenty-two years old; two are not yet in school. Her husband sells sand, which is used in housing construction.

Valerie sells produce such as sorghum, beans and maize. Her business is going well. Valerie’s enterprise has helped to feed her family and educate her children. She is requesting a loan to buy more produce such as sorghum, beans, etc. to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell.

loans.name: Hussam

texts.en:
Hussam is a 39-year-old married man, the father of one child and is from Marka, Jordan.

Hussam owns a snack shop. He is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to add a new retail section to his shop. Hussam aspires to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to add a new retail section to his shop.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is 35 years old and married. She has seven children who are aged four to fifteen years old; the youngest two are not yet in school. 

Charlotte works with her husband selling cassava and has been doing so for the past two years. This business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family. The profits have also enabled her to expand her business.

Charlotte is asking for a loan of 300,000 RWF to buy more cassava to sell and make more profits in order to support her children.With the profits she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cassava to sell.

loans.name: Leouidas

texts.en: Leouidas is 24 years old, he is not yet married. He sells cattle and he has been selling cattle for the past 5 years. This business has enabled Leouidas to meet all his needs and improve his standards of living. He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for sale and make more profits. With the profits together with his savings he plans to begin his family house construction.

loans.use: Buying cattle for sale.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en: Laila is a 55-year-old married woman and the mother of two children from A. Hashmi, Jordan. Laila is an accomplished embroiderer who started her own business from home that she expanded into a licensed clothing shop. Laila is requesting a loan of 600JD to purchase materiA. for her business. Laila aspires to open a second shop and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her clothing business.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 50 years old.  She has 9 children between 17 and 31 years old, all of whom have attended school. Her husband is a farmer.   Bernadette a been selling beans for the past 20 years.  This business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family. 

Bernadette is requesting a loan to buy more beans to sell. She hopes to make a profit out of her business and plans to use it to feed her family, pay school fees for her children and make some savings.

loans.use: buy beans to sell

loans.name: Raed

texts.en: Raed is a 35-year-old married man with one child from A. Bayader, Jordan. Raed owns an auto parts store. He is requesting a loan of 1500JD to purchase more parts and expand his business. Raed's goA. is to open a second store.

loans.use: to purchase more auto parts and expand his shop.

loans.name: Sauzan

texts.en: Sauzan is 43 years old, and she has one child, 24 years old. Her husband is a businessman. She sells different kinds of foodstuffs which include beans, sorghum and maize. She has been selling foodstuffs for 15 years and her business is going well. This business has enabled her to feed her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs to make more profit.With the profit she plans to feed her family and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Mitirikwi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 54-year-old Evelyn (holding the yellow file) from Masvingo. She is married with four children, all of whom have attended school. She also cares for two dependants. Evelyn runs a retail business selling blankets, clothes and shoes and employs two people. The business has been in operation for 11 years. She says the main challenges faced are market factors as those clients in the target market only get cash towards month's end. 

Evelyn has requested a loan of $300 to increase her stock levels of products. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family’s quality of life - increased stocks mean increased sales which in turn mean more income for the family. In the future Evelyn plans to own a shop and grinding mill.

loans.use: to increase stock levels of products such as blankets, clothes and shoes

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 54 years old. He has five children who are aged 13-24 years old. His wife is a farmer. 

Francois sells timber and he has been selling timber for 20 years. With this business he feeds his family with no difficulty. He is requesting a loan to buy equipment which will help him make timber products and hence make more income.

loans.use: to buy equipment for making timber products.

loans.name: Meliton

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC II”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

El socio Meliton tiene 34 años de edad y El  socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos  de 12 y 3 años de edad; el socio  tiene una panadería en su domicilio, el socio trabaja junto a su conyugue y ellos invierten en la compra de insumos y combustible para el horno, el socio indica que requiere comprar 5 sacos de harina, manteca 2 kilos y leña al por mayor para prender el horno a leña que tiene, el socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos y de combustible para el horno, el elabora panes de diferentes tipos, con mantequilla, los famosos huaro, pan francés, panes rejillas y pastelitos también; El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos y leña para la panadería. 
 
El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Melitón, 34, is a member of the “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC II” communal bank.  He lives in Urubamba District in Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

He has a spouse and two children who are 12 and 3 years of age.   He has a home-based bakery.  He works together with his spouse and will be investing in supplies and fuel for the oven.  He indicates that he needs to buy five sacks of flour, 2 kilos of lard and firewood at wholesale to light the wood burning oven he has.  He needs the loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients and fuel for the oven.  He makes all kinds of bread with butter, the famous “huaro” (traditional bread of Cusco), French bread, “rejilla” bread and little cakes too.  He is asking for the loan to buy supplies and firewood for the bakery.

He values and is infinitely grateful for the granted loan because it will help his business grow and him to improve his quality of life.  He also commits to make his installment payments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies and firewood.

loans.name: Los Barrios Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "LOS B." POR EL LUGAR DONDE VIVEN, ESTA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 10 INTEGRANTES Y ES LA PRIMERA VEZ QUE PIDEN UN PRESTAMO. MARIA ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO, ELLA TIENE 38 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA LA SECUNDARIA, ES COMERCIANTE, TIENE EN TOTAL 4 HIJOS 2 HOMBRES Y 2 MUJERES. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE TORTILLAS QUE INICIO HACE MASDE 5 AÑOS, SOLICITO EL PRESTAMO PARA PODER COMPRAR MAIZ Y MASA PARA REALIZAR SUS TORTILLAS. AL MOMENTO DE SOLICITAR EL PRESTAMO SE SIENTE MUY CONTENTA PUES GRACIAS A ESTE PRESTAMO PODRA CONSEGUIR MATERIA PRIMA EN MAYOREO Y ASÍ MÁS ECONOMICA CON ESTO VENDER MÁS CANTIDAD Y PODER GENERAR MÁS GANANCIAS PARA SEGUIR INVIERTIRNO EN SU PRODUCTO TODOS LOS DÍAS, YA QUE ESTO LO REALIZA DIARIAMENTE PARA QUE ESTE FRESCO Y AL DÍA. SUS CLIENTES SE EXPRESAN MUY BIEN DE ELLA, PUES COMENTAN QUE ES MUY HIGIÉNICA, ADEMÁS DE OFRECER UN TRATO AMABLE. LA SEÑORA ESPERA PODER SACAR ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS PARA DARLES UN MEJOR FUTURO Y ESTUDIOS Y ASÍ LOGREN SUS SUEÑOS Y SEAN UNOS GRANDES PROFESIONISTAS YA QUE ELLA NO LO PUDO TENER. OBSERVACIONES, LA SEÑORA QUE ESTA AL FONDO Y NO SE VE BIEN SE LLAMA ROSA.
texts.en:
This group is called “Los B.” (The Neighborhoods) after the place where they live.  It’s located in the State of México and has ten members.  This is the first time they’ve requested a loan.  

The group President is María, 38.  She completed secondary school.  She’s a merchant.  She has a total of four children, two boys and two girls.  She makes tortillas, a business she started over five years ago.  She asked for the loan to be able to buy more corn and masa (tortilla dough) to make her tortillas.  At the moment of requesting the loan she feels happy because thanks to the loan she’ll be able to get raw materials at wholesale which means more economically and so will be able to sell more and generate higher profits to continue investing in her products every day since this is something she does daily so that it will be fresh and up-to-date. Her customers speak very well of her because they comment that she’s very hygienic aside from offering very kind customer service.  

She hopes to be able to successfully raise her children to give them a better future and schooling so that they will reach their dreams and be great professionals since she was unable to do so.

Observation:  the name of the woman in the rear that isn’t clearly visible is Rosa.

loans.use: to buy tortilla making supplies.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en: Francois is 59 years old. He has four children who are aged 12-20 years. His wife does the same business with him. He sells second-hand clothes and he has been selling these clothes for the past 13 years. He is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and hence make more profit. He plans to continue feeding his family with the profit he plans to make.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rwensinga Tumanyane Group

texts.en:
32-year-old Julius sells foods such as beans, coffee and millet. He has been in this business for three years now. The happily married father of four transacts his business from Ntungamo in Western Uganda. He says the fact that he is a farmer has really been of much consequence, the long and short of it being that he is able to restock his stall with the aforementioned foods at his convenience. This normally happens when he is running short on supplies.  

Julius cites determination and perseverance as virtues which have kept him strong in this business. Monthly he says his business profits are to the tune of shillings 600,000. With this Kiva loan, he says  he is going to purchase high-grade manure for his farm.

loans.use: to purchase high-grade manure for his farm.

loans.name: Claude

texts.en: Claude is 29 years old and has three children between two and seven. His wife is a business woman. Claude has sold spare bicycle parts for 10 years. This business enables him to feed his family. He is requesting a loan to buy more spare parts and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE QOYLLORITY DE LUCRE”; La socia vive en el distrito de Lucre en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Maria Eugenia tiene 22 años de edad y La socia es soltera la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención como ayudenate en un restaurante, ella trabaja en un restaurante y se encarga de la atención como mesera, la socia también tiene su tienda de abarrotes y cuando no está en las mañanas trabajando en el restaurante está en su tienda toda la tarde, la socia ayuda a su madre en su tienda de abarrotes y ahora quiere comprar papas al por mayor para poder vender en su tienda, ellas hicieron un espacio de verduras y venta de papas en la misma tienda de abarrotes de tal modo que aquí se puede encontrar para poder cocinar algunos productos. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de papas para implementar en la tienda de abarrotes de su mama.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en: Maria belongs to the "SEÑOR DE QOYLLORITY DE LUCRE" community bank and lives in the district of Lucre, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco, Peru. She is 22 years old and single. She alternates her household activities with her job as a restaurant assistant. She works in a restaurant and is the head waitress. She also helps at a general store, and when she's not working mornings at the restaurant she is at the store the entire afternoon. She helps her mother with the store, and right now Maria wants to purchase potatoes at wholesale to sell at the shop. She and her mother set up a space in the store for vegetables and to sell potatoes in such a way that you can cook some of the products. Maria is requesting the loan to purchase potatoes to implement this into her mother's store. She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan since this will allow her to grow the business and improve her quality of life. She promises to repay the loan in the established period.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes to implement them into her mother's general store.

loans.name: Dushyigikirane Cb Group

texts.en: Jeanne, standing fourth from the right, is the president of Dushyigikirane CB — a Kinyarwanda word that means "let's support each other." Jeanne is 28 years old and has three children between four months and seven years old. Her two eldest children are in school. Jeanne sells goats and has done this business for four years and it is doing well. The majority of the other group members have small shops where they sell items that are commonly used at home such as soap, tea leaves, etc. Jeanne is requesting a loan to buy more goats for sale from which she expects to make profits. With the profits, together with her savings, she plans to build her own family house

loans.use: To purchase goats.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Pour renforcer son activité des matériaux de construction, Mr Komi père de 02 enfants sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter les matériaux. Sa femme est couturière. Il a commencé en 2009 en approvisionnant au Grand marché de Lomé et en revendant à son domicile.
texts.en: Komi, the father of two children, wants to strengthen his construction material business. He applies for this first loan to buy more materials. His wife is a seamstress. Komi opened his store in 2009. He gets his supplies at the great market in Lomé and resells in his home-based store.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Il ya de cela 04 ans que Mme Adjo a commencé son activité (vente des ignames). Son conjoint est revendeur et ils ont 02 enfants en commun. Elle sollicite ce second prêt pour acheter des ignames afin de renforcer son activité.
texts.en: Adjo started her business (sale of yams) four years ago. Her husband is a retailer. They have two children together. Adjo applies for her second loan to buy yams and strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy yams.

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en: Angelo, 25, is a teacher by profession. He is a bachelor who has been teaching for four years. He began teaching immediately he finished his studies at a university in Kampala. He teaches in Ntungamo. Monthly he says he makes about 470,000 as income. He also does some farming. He says he is going to use this loan to pay his tuition at a university in western Uganda where he is planning on upgrading his studies.

loans.use: To pay his university tuition fees

loans.name: Tanzania Group

texts.en: Hamisi, who is in his early 30s, is married with one small child. He has been running a general store for seven years, working from 7.00 am to 7.00 pm daily and making a small monthly profit. This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants a loan to increase the shop's inventory. His dream is to one day have a very big shop. He will share this loan with his group "Tanzania" which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase his shop's inventory.

loans.name: Sonia Andromaque

texts.fr: Née le 31 Août 1981 au Bénin, Sonia Andromaque est mariée à Jean un agent de la mairie. Le couple à trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Deux sont leurs propres enfants. Sonia Andromaque vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Sonia Andromaque assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis huit ans environs, Sonia Andromaque vend des produits cosmétiques et des mèches. Parallèlement à cela, Sonia Andromaque  vend divers produits. Sonia Andromaque s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les diverses charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Sonia Andromaque sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits dont Sonia Andromaque avait bénéficié ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Sonia Andromaque, born in Benin on August 31, 1981, is married to Jean, an employee at the mayor's office. They have three children, who all attend school and are in their care. Two of them are their own children. Sonia Andromaque lives with her husband and the children. The parents share the various household expenses.

For around eight years, Sonia Andromaque has been selling cosmetics and hair extensions. Next to this activity, she sells various products. She gets her supplies at one of the large markets in Benin. This activity generates enough income to enable her to provide for family expenses. In order to boost her activity level and make more profit she came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for her third loan. Sonia Andromaque has repaid her previous two loans on schedule.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, cosmetics and soap.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Née en 1976 au Bénin, Jacqueline est mariée à Isaac un conducteur Auto. Le couple à cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jacqueline vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Jacqueline assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Jacqueline a été à l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Jacqueline mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (savons, conserves, condiments de sauce, haricot, riz, etc.). Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Jacqueline sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits dont Jacqueline avait bénéficié ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Jacqueline was born in Benin in 1976 and is married to Issac, a car driver. They have five children, who all attend school and are in their care. Jacqueline lives with her husband and her children. The parents share the various household expenses. Jacqueline attended school until secondary level.

In order to provide for her needs and those of her children, Jacqueline sells various products like soap, canned food, sauce condiments, beans, rice, etc. In order to boost her activity level and make more profit she came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for her third loan. Jacqueline has repaid her previous two loans on schedule.

loans.use: to buy various articles like soap and canned food.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana  es una madre soltera de 24 años que vive con su pequeña hija y su madre en su casa que es propia. La difícil situación en que se encontraba la animó para que decidiera hacer su propio negocio. Es así que hace 2 años se dedica en la preparación de pasteles y leche asada que vende con ayuda de su madre, poco a poco su capital se ha ido incrementando, sin embargo sus deseos de crecimiento ha decidido solicitar un pequeño crédito para mejorar su capital de trabajo porque tiene más demanda de sus postres. Por tanto necesita mayor cantidad de ingredientes e insumos para la preparación de pasteles. Actualmente posee un horno de cocina que tiene en su misma casa, pero su deseo es disponer de su propio horno industrial y tener una tienda pastelera, tiene confianza de llegar a este nivel porque lo que produce son de muy buen sabor y calidad que garantiza el retorno del consumo de sus clientes antiguos y de nuevos. Ante esto pide el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para el cumplimiento de tal propósito. Es nueva integrante dentro de su banco comunal como crédito individual y también es su primera vez que solicita crédito por lo que se empeñará en tener un buen comportamiento crediticio ya que considera que es una gran oportunidad de desarrollo de su negocio. Por lo que este monto de dinero estará destinado en la compra de harina especial y leche en polvo por quintales, manteca, mantequilla y esencias al por mayor.
texts.en:
Juana is a 24-year-old single mother who lives with her young daughter and her mother in a home that she owns. Her difficult situation motivated her to start her own business. Two years ago, Juana started making pastries and flans to sell with the help of her mother. Over time her capital gradually increased. However, her desire for growth led to the decision to request a small loan to improve her operating capital since she has more demand for her desserts. Juana needs more ingredients and supplies for preparing the pastries. She currently has an oven in her home, but she wants to acquire her own industrial oven and eventually open a pastry shop. Juana is confident that she will reach this point because the desserts she produces have good flavor and their quality guarantees that both her long-time and new customers will return for more. She still needs assistance in order to accomplish her goal.

This new member of her Communal Bank will be receiving an individual loan. Also, this is the first time she has requested a loan. Juana will have to demonstrate that she is responsible with her loan payments, but considers her loan to be a great opportunity to develop her business. The amount of her loan will be used to buy special flour and powdered milk by the “quintal” (1 quintal = 46kg), lard, butter, and extracts in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase flour, powdered milk, lard, butter, and extracts of different flavors.

loans.name: Santa Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Santa Lucia tiene ya más de ocho años dedicándose a la venta de, televisiones, ropa, asesoraos de cocina y juguetes. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en su negocio ya que le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía como es ropa para niño, hombres, zapatos y aparatos electrónicos.
Desea de esta inversión en su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia, es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a tres hijos los cuales están estudiando.
texts.en:
For more than eight years, Sra. Santa Lucia has been selling televisions, clothes, kitchen accessories, and toys. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business because she lacks a wide variety of merchandise in her inventory such as clothing for children and men, shoes, and electronics.

Santa Lucia wants this investment for her business since it is the source of income by which she supports her family. She is a single mother and responsible for three children who are in school.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for children and men, shoes, and electronics.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 45 años, casado y padre de dos hijos en las edades de 11 y 12 años,  es un habitante de   San Jacinto, municipio del departamento de Bolívar, donde es muy conocido por ser  un buen ciudadano y comercializar carne mediante un expendio o punto de ventas donde le compran a través de unidades de peso como onzas, libras, kilos de acuerdo a las necesidades y posibilidades de sus clientes.  Esta experiencia es tradicional para Carlos, porque él la aprendió de su padre y en la actualidad es su propio negocio, el que le permite un ingreso  suficiente para el sostenimiento de su familia y por eso quiere hacerlo crecer,  pues  planea mayor bienestar para sus hijos que en la actualidad están pequeños y son estudiantes. Carlos vende de contado y también a crédito, el tiene además de sus herramientas como peso cuchillo hacha, mesas, un congelador  con muy buena capacidad de almacenamiento que necesita aprovechar más efectivamente.  Su meta más adelante es modernizar su carnicería con maquinarias especiales en un local bien acondicionado  y contiguo a su vivienda;  su mayor desafío ocurre esporádicamente, cuando en el pueblo suspenden el fluido eléctrico por mantenimiento o reparación del sistema eléctrico y   debe acudir a la vieja técnica de salar la carne y promocionarla, teniendo como base  la preparación de deliciosos sancochos trifásicos, que incluyen tres tipos de carnes saladas. Mientras Carlos trabaja generando una rentabilidad sobre la venta no menor del 17%, continua esforzándose por aumentar su capital de trabajo mediante financiamiento, propósito por el cual acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a su primer financiamiento; con su credikiva comprará carne en mayor volumen, para aumentar su clientela y ofrecer un producto que comprado en mayor volumen,  le permite un buen descuento que traslada a sus clientes, con tal de conservarlos y multiplicarlos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 45 years old, married, and the father of two children (ages 11 and 12). He is a resident of San Jacinto, a town in the Department of Bolívar, where he is well-known for being a good citizen and a meat vendor. Carlos has a butcher shop where he sells meat by the ounce, by the pound, or by the kilo according to the needs of his customers. His experience included a traditional upbringing. Carlos learned his trade from his father and now he has his own business, which allows him to earn enough income to support his family. However, he wants to grow his business so that he can provide for the greater welfare of his children while they are still young and in school.

Carlos sells his products for cash and also on credit. He has the necessary equipment for his job such as knives, cleavers, tables, and a freezer with very good storage capacity of which he needs to make more effective use. His plans going forward are to modernize his butcher shop with special machines and to secure a well-equipped location near his home. The greatest challenge he faces is dealing with the sporadic power outages that occur whenever the town has to perform maintenance and repairs. As a result, he has to resort to the old technique of salting the meats in order to preserve them. He encourages his customers to prepare a delicious stew that includes three types of salted meat. In the meantime, Carlos works toward generating a profit margin of no less than 17% from his sales. He continually strives to improve his operating capital by securing financing.

For this reason, he has come to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for his first loan. Using the Kiva funds, Carlos will buy meat in large amounts so that he can expand his customer base and sell more products to them. This will allow him to offer discounts so that he can attract and keep his customers.

loans.use: to purchase meat in bulk.

loans.name: Nacianceno

texts.es:
Nacianceno es un cliente de 37 años de edad. Vive con su esposa y 2 hijos en el distrito de Reque en Chiclayo. La zona donde Nacianceno vive es una comunidad rural muy humilde, no cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz y de agua potable y la actividad principal de esta comunidad es la crianza de animales y la agricultura.

Nacianceno tiene varios años de experiencia criando animales (ganado vacuno) en la parte posterior de su hogar. Nacianceno vende sus animales, una vez que estos alcanzan el peso y tamaño adecuado, a los habitantes de su comunidad. Él cuenta con clientela establecida.

Nacianceno desea ampliar su negocio con la crianza de animales menores (patos y cuyes) y es este motivo el que lo ha llevado a solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 900 nuevos soles, para comprar los animales. 

Nacianceno es un cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa, con su primer crédito pudo continuar brindando el servicio de mototaxi, el cual es su segunda actividad.
texts.en:
Nacianceno is a 37 year-old client who lives with his wife and two children in Reque district, in Chiclayo.  The area where Nacianceno lives is a very poor, rural community which does not have basic services such as electricity and drinking water.  The main business activities in this community are livestock raising and farming.

Nacianceno has several years experience raising animals (cattle) in an area out the back of his home.  Nacianceno sells his animals to the residents of his community once they have reached an ideal weight and size.  He has an established customer base.

Nacianceno would like to expand his business by raising animals such as ducks and guinea pigs.  He is requesting a loan for 900 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy animals.

Nacianceno is an existing client of Edpyme Alternativa.  Thanks to his first loan, he was able to continue providing a service with his motorcycle taxi, which is his second business activity.

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: Lucy Betty

texts.es:
Lucy es una mujer trabajadora de 40 años de edad. Ella vive en casa familiar con sus 5 hijos en una comunidad urbana de comerciantes que se encuentra en vías de desarrollo. La zona donde vive Lucy es el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz perteneciente a la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lucy tiene 7 años de experiencia en su negocio. Ella vende menestras  en un pequeño puesto ambulante ubicado en las afueras del mercado Moshoqueque (el mercado popular con mayor régimen de ventas en el norte)

Lucy solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para  surtir su negocio con nueva mercadería como ajo, culantro, ajíes y distintas especies que tienen gran demanda en su puesto. 

 Lucy desea invertir en su negocio para aumentar sus ventas y poder darle comodidades a sus 5 hijos.
texts.en:
Lucy is a hard-working 40 year old woman.  She lives with her five children in a urban community of merchants that is in the process of developing.  Lucy lives in the José Leonardo Ortiz district in the city of Chiclayo.

Lucy has seven years of experience with her business.  She sells vegetable stew at a small traveling stall located on the outskirts of the Moshoqueque market (the popular market with a large arrangement of sales in the north).  

Lucy is asking for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles with Edpyme Alternativa to stock her business with new merchandise like garlic, cilantro, peppers, and other items that she has a demand for at her stand.

Lucy wants to invest in her business to increase her sales and give comforts to her five children

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (ingredients).

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: El  Sr. Iván es un joven de 26 años de edad, vive en la zona de villa salome que esta ubicada a 40 minutos del centro de la ciudad. Iván trabaja como constructor desde hace 10 meses pero anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de edredones y colchas en la localidad de palos blancos en la provincia de los yungas, dejó de viajar con estos productos debido a que decidió quedarse en la paz y ayudar a sus padres ya que ellos están pasando por problemas económicos. Él es muy trabajador y responsable dicen sus padres y sus hermanos ya que el solo esta manteniendo la casa. Iván solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas para su trabajo de construcción, ya que tiene que realizar un trabajo muy importante y le faltan herramientas, esta agradecido con  la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Iván is a young man who is 26 years of age. He lives in the District of Villa Salome, which is 40 minutes away from the central part of the city. Iván has worked as a builder for the past 10 months. He previously sold quilts and blankets in the town of Palos Blancos in Los Yungas Province. Iván stopped traveling to sell these products because he wanted to stay in La Paz and help his parents who are experiencing financial difficulties. His parents and siblings say he is hardworking and responsible since he is the only person maintaining their household.

Iván is requesting a loan to buy tools for his construction work. His job is very important, but he lacks the equipment. Iván is grateful to Emprender for the support being provided.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his construction work.

loans.name: Katya

texts.es: Katya es una joven de 25 años, vive en compañía de su madre y hermana en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 5 años decidió generarse sus propias fuentes de ingreso  ejerciendo así su profesión de chef, en donde prepara comida por pedidos, ya sea en eventos sociales como banquetes. Por otro lado prepara alimentos como tamales y postres, entre ellos la leche asada que son vendidos de manera ambulante, así se genera más ganancias. Otra de sus fuentes de ingreso es el servicio de lavado de ropa que realiza en su casa con su lavadora automática y adicionalmente a esto también tiene un trabajo de manera dependiente como docente en un centro educativo. Manifiesta que le agrada trabajar en múltiples tareas porque le permite tener efectivo siempre que lo necesita, además gracias a las ganancias que ha venido recibiendo ha podido mudarse a una casa con su madre y su hermana en un lugar independiente ya que antes vivían en casa de un familiar y el espacio era reducido. Ella solita un préstamo para que pueda continuar con sus múltiples actividades y poder salir adelante. Es la quinta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ya tiene varios años de experiencia de trabajo grupal dentro de su banco comunal y en todo este tiempo ha venido demostrando su madurez en asuntos financieros porque en cada crédito ha sabido invertirlo sabiamente ya que en la actualidad tiene sus negocios  consolidados. En esta ocasión el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de una lavadora moderna y cerveza para sus próximas nueva venta de este producto.
texts.en:
Katya is a young woman who is 25 years old. She lives with her mother and sister in a rented house. Five years ago, she decided to generate her own income by pursuing a profession as a chef. She prepares food made to order at social events, such as banquets. Katya also makes snacks such as tamales and desserts, such as flans that she sells as a street vendor, in order to generate more income. To earn even more income, she also provides laundry services from her home. She has a washing machine and also works as a substitute teacher at a school. Katya says she is grateful to have multiple jobs because it enables her to always have what she needs. Thanks to the money she earned, she was able to move into a house with her mother and sister so that they could live independently. They previously lived at a relative’s house that lacked enough space. Katya is requesting a loan so that she can continue with her multiple jobs and get ahead.

This is the fifth time she has requested a loan from MFP. She has several years of experience working with her Communal Bank. In that time, Katya has demonstrated her maturity in dealing with financial matters because she has invested wisely with each loan and now has consolidated her business activities. On this occasion, she will invest in the purchase of a modern washing machine and beer to generate new sales of this product.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine and beer to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Elcidia

texts.es:
Gloria, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, se dedica a la venta de verduras, frutas y mariscos, tiene 27 años de ser comerciante, y lo aprendió por sus amistades, hoy en día le ayuda a su esposo para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de verduras, papas, güisquiles, también manzanas, uvas, peras, y pescado, esta inversión le ayudara a tener mayor disponibilidad de productos para poder atender la demanda, brindando un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Los sueños de ella es aumentar sus ventas, ampliarse a atender nuevas zonas, con el fin de generar mayores ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Gloria lives with her husband and children. She sells vegetables, fruits, and seafood. Gloria has been a merchant for 27 years and learned the business from her friends. Today she is able to help her husband with providing for their household needs.

Gloria is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, potatoes, chayote squash, apples, grapes, pears, and fish. This investment will help make available more products so that she can keep up with demand and provide better service to her customers.

Her dreams are to increase her sales and to expand into new areas so that she can generate more household income.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, potatoes, chayote squash, apples, grapes, pears, and fish.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: La Sra. Nely se dedica a la comercialización de verduras y la producción de leche para su posterior comercialización se dedica a esta actividad desde hace diez años , solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras por cantidad y también para una mescladora de cemento el cual lo utilizara su esposo quien es albañil, vive en domicilio propio, tiene cinco niños quienes además colaboran con los quehaceres de la casa y la atención de el ganado, no cuenta con muchos bienes ya que recientemente sufrieron el robo de su domicilio y les dejaron sin nada, la Sra. Nely es una persona trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Nely is a vegetable vendor and milk producer. She has been selling these products for 10 years. Nely is requesting a loan to buy vegetables in bulk and also acquire a cement mixer for her husband since he works as a mason. She lives in her own home and has five children who help with the household chores and tending of the livestock. Nely does not have many possessions since her home was recently robbed and her family was left with nothing.

Sra. Nely is a hardworking person who is grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables in bulk and a cement mixer for her husband's masonry business.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Née en 1977 au Bénin, Antoinette est mariée à un certain Germain. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leurs charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Antoinette n’a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour assurer les besoins de sa famille, Antoinette vend depuis près de dix ans divers produits (savons, lait en poudre, etc.) à son domicile au Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Antoinette prépare de l'"Akassa" (une pâte faite à base de la farine du maïs) accompagné de poissons frits qu'elle vend à son domicile. Pour améliorer ses prestations et se faire plus de revenus, Antoinette sollicite pour une troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Antoinette was born in Benin in 1977 and is married to Germain. They have three children, who all attend school and are in their care. The parents share the various household expenses. Antoinette attended only elementary school.

In order to provide for the family, Antoinette has been selling various products, like soap and milk powder, from her home in Benin for nearly ten years. Next to this activity, she makes akassa (a kind of pastry prepared from corn starch) and sells it with fried fish at her home. In order to improve her service and make more profit she came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for the third time for financial assistance. Antoinette has repaid her previous two loans on schedule.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and fried fish.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
José, vive con sus padres y hermanos, él trabaja como auxiliar de servicio en Fosalud (unidad médica), desde hace cinco años, luego decidió instalar su propio negocio en el que vende tacos, tortas, burritos, tiene un año de estar en este negocio, su objetivo era contar con dos fuentes de ingreso, que le permitiera tener una mejor estabilidad.
Actualmente necesita invertir en materiales para incrementar la variedad de productos y tener mejor disponibilidad, comprando, pan especial para las tortas, pollo, carnes rojas, condimentos, tomates, cebollas, con estos ingredientes, él espera mejorar su servicio con esta inversión.
Su objetivo es seguir mejorando con el negocio e incrementar la variedad en sus productos, también crecer en clientela, de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his parents and siblings. He has worked as an assistant for Fosalud (a medical service company) for the past five years. José also decided to start his own business selling tacos, sandwiches, and burritos. He has operated his business for one year. His goal was to have two sources of income in order to provide better stability.

José currently needs to invest in supplies so that he can make available a wider variety of products. He will buy special bread for sandwiches, chicken, red meat, condiments, tomatoes, and onions. With these ingredients, he hopes that his investment will result in better service.

His goals are to continue improving his business and to provide a wider variety of products. He also wants to grow his customer base so that he can generate more income to provide for his family’s welfare.

loans.use: to purchase special bread for sandwiches, chicken, red meat, condiments, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es: Hernando  es un hombre  dedicado a los negocios, por un lado ofrece el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras, en su municipio San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar, desde hace tres años, después de ganar experiencia de negocio trabajando con un familiar en este servicio y como es una persona consiente de las oportunidades aprovecha al máximo su clientela y también le ofrece sandalias que compra en volumen y vende al detal mediante créditos y así mismo con su cónyuge, tiene otras inversiones como la venta de motocicletas a créditos, cartera que cobran mensualmente. Su negocio de lavadoras se ha fortalecido en cuanto a la clientela, pero sus lavadoras están necesitando reemplazo y por eso tiene como meta comprar otras maquinarias, con tal de responder a su clientela de la mejor manera y continuar generando utilidades para aumentar el  bienestar de su hogar;  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará tres lavadoras  y también modernos diseños de sandalias,  que están muy de moda entre las mujeres de la población. Inversiones que planea serán exitosas, porque responden a pedidos y porque aumentarán sus posibilidades de atender nuevos clientes en el servicio de lavadoras, especialmente los días viernes, sábados, domingos y feriados cuando se quedan muchos clientes sin ser atendidos. Mientras Hernando construye sus sueños, se esmera trabajando para  aumentar su rentabilidad sobre las ventas que en la actualidad es no menor del 29%.
texts.en:
Hernando is a gentleman who is devoted to his businesses. One of them involves renting out washing machines in the town of San Jacinto, which is in the Department of Bolívar. He started this business three years ago after he gained experience working for a relative who provided this same service. Hernando is the type of person who is aware of opportunities and takes advantage of them to the fullest. He started another business buying sandals in bulk and selling them on credit. His wife takes part in this business. He has other investments, such as selling motorcycles on credit and collecting payments each month.

His washing machine rental business has been strengthened in terms of more customers, but the equipment needs to be replaced. For this reason, his goal is to buy more machines so that he can respond better to his customers and continue generating income to improve his family’s well-being. This Kiva loan is the first one he has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Hernando will use the funds to buy three washing machines, as well as sandals that come in modern designs that will appeal to the local women. He foresees that his investments will be successful since he will be able to respond to service requests and increase his chances of attracting new customers who need to rent washing machines. His busiest times are on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays, and fair days since many customers have no one else who can meet the demand on those days. While he continues to build his dream, Hernando strives to increase profitability. At the moment, the profit margin from his sales is a minimum of 29%.

loans.use: to acquire three washing machines for his rental business and to purchase sandals to sell.

loans.name: Benjamin Meliton

texts.es:
Benjamín, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y una hija, sus cultivos son en maíz, maicillo, frijol y tabaco, tiene muchos años de estar realizando estos cultivos, aprendió cuando era joven al lado de su padre.
Él solicita un préstamo para el alquiler de cinco manzanas de terreno más todos los insumos necesarios para la siembra (abono, insecticidas, fertilizantes), ya que se dispone a realizar la siembra de maíz, maicillo, frijol, tabaco.
Este préstamo le ayudara a seguir realizando sus labores agrícolas, él tiene mucho entusiasmo por este oficio, ya que de la producción depende los ingresos para su familia y sostenibilidad del hogar.
texts.en:
Benjamin is a farmer who lives with his wife and daughter. His crops include corn, sorghum, beans, and tobacco. Benjamin has been growing these crops for many years. He learned to farm as a young man by working alongside his father.

The loan he is requesting will be used to rent five additional plots of land and to buy the necessary supplies for planting such as compost, insecticides, and fertilizers. These items will be used for planting corn, sorghum, beans, and tobacco.

This loan will help him continue with his farm work. He has great enthusiasm for this job because his family’s income and the maintenance of his home depend on his production.

loans.use: to pay the rent on five plots of land and to purchase compost, insecticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Hawai Group

texts.en: Yahaya, who is in his early twenties, is single with one small child. He has had a video libraly since 2000. He works from 9.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and makes a small monthly profit. This will be Yahaya's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he hopes will help him renovate his business premises by painting inside the shop, polishing the shelves and putting in floor tiles. His dream is to one day expand his shop. He will share this loan with the 16 members of his loan group "Hawai" who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To renovate his business premises by painting inside the shop, polishing selves and putting in floor tile.

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
Cándida, tiene 69 años de edad, es madre soltera de una joven de 16 años de edad; Cándida tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse al negocio de la panadería, este pan lo elabora en su casa y sale a vender  junto a su hija de 6:00am a 10:00am, por los caseríos cercanos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar harina, huevos y azucar además tiene el plan de iniciar el cultivo de maíz por lo que aprovechara con el préstamo a adquirir abono y fertilizantes, este crédito le ayudara a tener materiales para el negocio del pan y para iniciar el cultivo, cubriendo así dos áreas productivas de Cándida.
Los sueños de ella son crecer en el negocio, aumentando su producción y teniendo personal para que venda en la zona, también ayudar a su hija para que pueda accesar al estudio y se pueda superar.
texts.en:
Cándida is 69 years old.  She is a single mother of a 16-year-old young woman.  Cándida has been a Baker for over ten years.  She bakes the bread at home and goes out to sell it with her daughter from 6am until 10am throughout the neighboring hamlets.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy flour, eggs and sugar.  She also plans to start farming corn so will use the loan to buy manure and fertilizer.  This loan will help her have supplies for the bakery and to start her planting thus covering Cándida’s two productive areas.

Her dreams are to grow in business increasing production and having sales personnel in the zone and also to help her daughter access schooling so that she can improve herself.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs and sugar.

loans.name: Kristy

texts.es: Kristy de 28 años vive al lado de sus padres en la propiedad que adquirieron desde hace varios años. Desde hace 3 años descubrió un nuevo mercado, desde entonces se dedica a preparar desayunos (compuestos de nutritivos ingredientes) que vende todos los días a los trabajadores. No es un trabajo fácil ya que debe madrugar todos los días  y con la ayuda de su prima prepara mates, café o avenas con leche. Acompañado de pan con queso, mantequilla; de acuerdo a las exigencias de sus comensales. Hasta el momento considera que su negocio es muy rentable, porque tiene clientes fijos que siempre le consumen y son muy exigentes con los alimentos que prepara. Con este negocio ha mejorado su economía y tiene un ingreso importante para su hogar, además de que tiene la opción de estudiar por las tardes logrando así concretar sus deseos de superación. Por tanto espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para concretar sus planes. Es su quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, tiene un buen historial de sus créditos  pues siempre fue puntual en sus pagos y motiva constantemente a su grupo del banco comunal a ser responsables financieramente. En esta ocasión  el dinero lo destinará  en la implementación de su negocio, en ingredientes no perecibles como avena, quinua, azúcar; así como también en envases descartables, bolsas y baldes que son necesarios para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Kristy, 28, lives with her parents in a house they acquired several years ago.  Three years ago she discovered a new market and since then has been preparing breakfasts (composed of nutritional ingredients) that she sells daily to laborers.  It isn’t an easy job because she has to rise at dawn every day and with help from her cousin prepare mates (herbal teas), coffee or oatmeal with milk which are served accompanied by bread with butter or cheese according to her customers’ wishes.  To date, she considers the business to be very profitable because she has regular customers that always consume and are quite exacting with their requests for the food she prepares.  The business has helped her improve her economy and she has an income that’s important for her home.  Besides, she’s able to attend classes in the afternoon thus attaining her wish for self improvement.  Because of all this she’s hoping to have support from all of you.

This is her 5th loan with MFP.  She has a good credit history; she was always punctual and is always encouraging her communal bank members to be financially responsible.

On this occasion she will use the money to stock her business with non-perishable items like oatmeal, quinoa, sugar as well as disposable packaging, bags and buckets that she needs for her business’ operation.

loans.use: to buy oatmeal, quinoa, sugar, disposable packaging and buckets.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene 56 años de edad, es madre de familia y vive con su esposo e hija en una comunidad pequeña y rural perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. Gregoria  es una mujer trabajadora que goza de buenas referencias personales. 

Gregoria se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, porcino y aves de corral, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años. Cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos y una vez que sus animales alcanzan tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local.  Con las ganancias obtenidas ella ayuda a su esposo, quien es agricultor, con los gastos del hogar.

Gregoria solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales, así como en la implementación de un corral nuevo en la parte trasera de su domicilio, lo que le permitirá ampliar su ganado y criarlo en condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a 56-year-old mother who lives with her husband and daughter in a small rural community in the District of Tambogrande-Piura. She is a hardworking woman who has earned good personal references.

Gregoria raises sheep, pigs, and poultry. She has been in business for 10 years. Gregoria has the appropriate animal pens and adequate space. Once the animals have reached their ideal size and weight, she sells them at the local market. She uses her earnings to help her husband, a farmer, with the household expenses.

Gregoria is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN. She will invest the money in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals. In addition, she will build a new corral behind her house so that she can acquire more animals and raise them in adequate conditions.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and to build a new corral.

loans.name: Jaime Rolando
