Together with her husband, she has a grocery store in her home, where they sell all types of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, etc. They work every day from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m., and sometimes even later, since many people get together at night for social occasions, and her husband takes advantage of this to sell beverages. The products to stock their store are purchased in downtown Portoviejo, although most of them are delivered to the store. They have operated the store for ten years and it is going very well for them. Matilde reports that she likes her work, since her family is always together, and this lets her help her small children with their homework. 

She will use this loan to add a greater variety of stock to her store, buying rice, sugar, oils, detergents, processed meats and other basic products. She has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles, and she likes it because she has made new friends in the group. 
 
Her goals are to expand her house and see her store grow a little more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, processed meats and other basic products.

loans.name: María Dioselina

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como la calle 26 De Septiembre en la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Los Nardos.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 3 y de 1 año ocho meses. Su esposo es Ing. En sistemas.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo de muchas marcas nacionales y extranjeras. Además de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo por las noches ya que a esa hora ya tiene  con quien dejar a sus pequeños hijos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Los productos Yanbal  los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en el centro en una distribuidora. Lleva 5 meses  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien a pesar del poco tiempo, nos cuenta que empezó este negocio con uno de los créditos que recibió de la institución, antes se dedicaba a otro tipo de negocios pero no le fue muy bien por eso cambio y ahora le va mejor.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo.
 
Su sueño es tener casa propia ya que donde vive es alquilado.

En la foto nuestra socia está con su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
In the sector known as 26th of September Street in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the “Los Nardos” (The Spikenards) Communal Bank meet every 15 days.

Maria is a founding member of this communal bank and she likes it because the interest rates are lower than in other credit institutions.  She is 24 years of age, married, and from this union has come 2 children aged 3 and 1 year 8 months. Her husband is a systems engineer. 

Maria is a housewife who, to obtain her own resources, dedicates herself to selling clothing from a catalog containing many national and foreign brands. In addition, she sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for ladies). Maria works 3 days a week, plus every night, when during these hours she has someone to leave the children with. She sells her products on credit and collects each week or every 15 days, according to her customer's preferences. Maria receives the Yanbal products at home, and the clothing in the center at a distributorship. She has been doing this for 5 months and it is going very well, despite the short time. Maria tells us that she began this business with one of the loans she received from our institution. Before that, she was tried a different type of business but it didn't go well, and so she made the change and, now, business is much better.

This loan is for buying perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing of all types.

Her dream is to have her own house, since where she lives now is rented.

In our picture, Maria appears with her little daughter.

loans.use: buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Hilda

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Mapasingue  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Damas de San Lorenzo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 55 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y de esta relación tuvo  ocho hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad, tres hijas aun viven con ella y una de ellas estudia en una Academia artesanal.

Ella para ganarse la vida y para que a sus hijas no les falte nada desde hace muchos años trabaja realizando los queseares domésticos en una casa de la ciudad de Portoviejo. También se dedica a la agricultura ya que su esposo les dejo una finca, él se dedicaba a la agricultura y ella siguió con esto porque también le da ganancia, ella como es mujer y no puede hacer este trabajo pesado contrata personal y a estos obreros les paga un sueldo, ella siembra cultivos en las temporadas de invierno y en la actualidad necesita del crédito para pagar a los obreros para recoger la cosecha.
 
Para esto va a emplear su crédito para pagar sueldos y así poder guardar sus productos para venderlos después de un tiempo a mejor precio. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener buena cosecha y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the place known as Mapasingue in the Colon parish of Portoviejo, a place that is known for its hard-working people who are engaged in agriculture and livestock farming, the members of the Community Bank "Ladies of San Lorenzo" meet every two weeks.   

Here we met Señora Rosa, who is 55 years old.  Several years ago her husband died; she has eight children from this relationship, all of whom are now grown.  Three daughters still live with her, one of whom is studying at a crafts Academy.

For her livelihood, and so that her daughters can have everything they need, she has for many years worked as a domestic in a house in the city of Portoviejo. She is also involved in agriculture since her husband left them an estate. His occupation was farming, and she continued with this because it provides additional income.  As a woman, she cannot do this tough job herself and hires salaried workers.  She planted crops in the winter and now needs the loan to pay the workers for the harvest. 

This loan is to be used to pay the salaries and thus be able to store her products in order to sell them later when the price is highest. This is her first time with the community bank and she enjoys the support she receives with the loans. 

His dream is to have a good harvest and advance in life.

loans.use: to pay the salaries of her workers.

loans.name: Adela Maribel

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Mapasingue  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Damas de San Lorenzo.

La señora Adela es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos y no piden tantos requisitos. Tiene  32 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 12 años de edad el mismo que  estudian en  colegio. Vive sola con su hijo.

Ella es una gran madre que por su hijo está dispuesta a sacrificarse y a trabajar duro con tal de que a él nunca le falte nada, para esto hace tres años decidió poner en su casa un mini bazar con lo cual además de ganarse para el sustento diario también está al tanto de las necesidades de su querido hijo. Trabaja todos los días en su local, allí los clientes pueden encontrar variedad de  productos como ropa, juguetes, bisutería entre otras cosas, nos cuenta que su negocio lo empezó con el primer crédito y que poco a poco lo ha ido aumentando.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar ropa, juguetes, cosméticos, bisutería, etc. para surtir aun más su negocio.

Sus sueños son tener un gran local y que su hijo  sea profesional.
texts.en:
In the locality with the name of Mapasingue in Portoviejo's Colon Parish, known for its hard working people dedicated to farming and cattle raising, the “Damas de San Lorenzo” communal bank meets every two weeks.

Adela is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because of the ease in getting loans and because they don’t ask for so many requirements.  She is 32 years old and a single mother of a 12-year-old son who is in school.  She lives alone with her son.

She is a great mother who is willing to sacrifice and work hard for her son so that he will never lack anything.  For this, she set up a small store in her house three years ago so that, besides earning daily sustenance, she can also be watching over her beloved son’s needs.  She works every day in her store.  Customers can find there a wide variety of goods like clothes, toys and costume jewelry, among other things.  She tells us that she started the business with her first loan and gradually has been enlarging it.

She will use this loan to buy clothes, toys, cosmetics, costume jewelry, etc. to better stock her store.  Her dreams are to have a great store and that he son becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothes, toys, cosmetics, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Sut

texts.en: Sut, 45, is a humble woman and the mother of four children. One is married and lives in another house, while the other three are single, two of whom are employed in manufactoring as garment factory workers in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. Sut has had a job as a local farmer for a long time on her own farmland in Kompong Cham Province. She has a life partner, her husband, who has worked as a teacher in the local school for several years. She normally generates an average of $2.50 profit a day and uses her income to meet all her family’s needs. Presently, Sut doesn’t have funds to pay for things in the rainy season. For that reason, Sut decided to look for a loan from Kiva to pay for plowing, to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting on time.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting on time.

loans.name: Khlok

texts.en: Khlok was born in 1962 and now lives in Siem Reap Province. To make a daily income she sells a kind of Khmer cake. She has operated this business since she was single. From this, she is able to earn around $2.50 profit a day to support her other financial expenses. She always receives help from her husband who works as a domestic cultivator as well as a musician for extra income. Usually, he can generate income of about $2.90 each day. Khlok planted rice crops two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer and to pay for plowing. She hopes to use the rest of her loan funds to repair her broken motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer, pay for plowing and repair her broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his old house.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
JANETH
La señora Janet, es socia del banco comunal Las Gemas. Distrito yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 27 años de edad, casada y con 3 niños.
Tiene su venta de frutas y golosinas en la puerta de su casa, donde atiende a sus vecinos muy amablemente, todos los días tiene que ir hasta al mercado para poder traer las frutas frescas.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/1,200.00 nuevos soles comprara: 1 ciento de mandarina, 1 ciento de naranja, ½ ciento de limón, 2 tiras de papas fritas, 1 caja de galletas, 2 tiras de chupetines.
No tiene que descuidar su hogar para poder trabajar, y lo hace bien porque también está pendiente con sus hijos y no los descuida, los tiene bien atendidos, no es mucho lo que gana pero tiene un pequeño ingreso fruto de su trabajo.
Su esposo contento porque ya tiene una pequeña ayuda por parte de su esposa, una familia mas que tiene que agradecer a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que brinda a las mujeres.
texts.en:
Janeth
Janeth is a member of Las Gemas communal bank, in the Yarinacocha district,  department of Ucayali.  She is 27, married and has 3 children.

She sells fruit and sweets in front of her house where she cheerfully takes care of her neighbors every day.  She has to go as far as the market to bring back fresh fruit.
With her new loan of 1200 new sols she will buy: one hundred tangerines, 100 oranges, 50 limes, 2 strips of French fries, a box of cookies and 2 strips of  lollipops.
She doesn’t have to neglect her house to be able to work and she stays in this business because she can take care of her children and not leave them.  She is very attentive to them and although she doesn’t earn much, she has a small income as the fruit of her labor.
Her husband is content because his wife can help a little.  This is another family that is thankful to Manuela Ramos for the support that it offers women.

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Anarose

texts.en:
Anarose is a farmer working in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice, but also raises pigs to sell at the market. She works hard to support her family.

Anorose's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and livestock feeds. She hopes to earn better income and have her own savings.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and livestock feeds

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, 29, is a driver. He also supplements his income with another business – buying cows and oxen and selling them to a middleman who comes to buy them at his house. His wife, Srey Oun plants small mango trees and sells them from home.  The couple lives in a village off National Road Number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.   They have been married since 2008 and just had a young daughter. 

Sophea is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase more cows and oxen for sale.

loans.use: purchase more cows and oxen

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon, 54, is a widow with four sons and one daughter – two are garment factory workers, one assists his mother in the farming business,  and other two are in school. The family lives in a village along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Thon is farmer. She hopes to buy cows and oxen to raise so she will be able to earn extra income from selling them when they grow big enough. That’s why Thon is asking for a loan of $1,200 to make the purchase.

loans.use: purchase cows and oxen

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 40 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. Her oldest child is 17 years old. Angela's husband is a farmer.

Angela has had a sari-sari store for 19 years. She sells items like sugar, noodles and canned goods. She also makes and sells banana cue. Angela plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and packed noodles. She will also buy fertilizers for the farm that her husband tills.

In the future, Angela hopes to have a bigger store.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farm and items to sell in her store

loans.name: Ratana

texts.en:
Ratana is a security guard and his wife, Mom, is a weaver. He is asking for a loan of $700 to help with his wife’s weaving business by buying weaving materials.

This couple has been married since 1989 and has five children  – three sons and two daughters. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: buy weaving materials

loans.name: Savin

texts.en:
Savin (pictured with her loom) is a weaver. She also buys finished silk from the local villagers and sells it in other provinces far from her house. She is requesting another loan of $200 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

Savin lives on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has two sons and one daughter. Both of her children are in school.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em (pictured here) and his wife, Puthavy, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have a young daughter.  

Em works for a company that supplies construction materials, while his wife is a garment factory worker. The couple have previously asked for a Kiva loan to buy a motorcycle. Now, Em is requesting $1,000 to purchase another motorbike for his sister to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his sister to drive to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike for riding to work.

loans.name: Deolita

texts.en:
Deolita earns a living growing corn and raising livestock. She tills land in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She raises pigs and chickens in her backyard. Deolita works hard to improve her businesses and increase the family income.

Deolita has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and livestock feed. She hopes to have a stable business soon.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and livestock feed

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion  is from the village of Kinuman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Visitacion is widowed and has 4 adult children. Visitacion owns & operates an agricultural business, planting & harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Visitacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Visitacion is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds. This will be her seventh loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en:
Sokhan (pictured here), 38, is a garment factory worker. Her husband, Phalla, 33, is a lotus farmer and does construction work when he is free.  Sokhan is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help her husband to purchase a water pump, seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his lotus farm.

They do not yet have children. They live in a village along national road number two, approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: To help her husband to purchase a water pump, seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his lotus farm.

To make a living, Chona owns & operates a business operating motor transport services. Chona has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Chona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Chona is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Chona from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 48 years old and married to a farmer. They have five children. The oldest child is 28 years old and the youngest is 20.

Elsa raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market. She also grows vegetables to sell. Elsa plans to use her loan to buy pig feed, vitamins and fertilizers. She hopes to have a productive business that will help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, vitamins and fertilizers

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang currently lives in a wooden house in Ornlong Veng commune of Siem Reap Province. In order to earn an income, she sells sugar cane juice at home and generates around $2.50 per day to cover the family’s daily expenses. Neang’s husband works in a crop-planting business. He uses her inherited land to plant various crops and he has had great success growing crops which is an annual process. He is able to plant the crops at least twice a year. Neang will use her loan funds to assist her husband to purchase gasoline to fuel the plowing machine and to buy seed potatoes for planting.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline to fuel the plowing machine and to buy seed potatoes for planting.

This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Carmelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng and her husband had a photo taken together in her tailoring shop. They always help each other to serve both old and new customers.  This couple runs their business very well and a lot of customers admire the good service they are providing. In addition, Heng sells many goods at her house to her neighbors for more profit. Heng has four children, three are single and the other one is married. All of them help her in the same business. Heng will use her loan to build a new kitchen and repair her old toilet.

loans.use: to build a new kitchen and repair her old toilet.

loans.name: Joepet Jade

texts.en:
Joepet Jade  is from Las Aguadas, Ozamiz City. He is 26 years old. Joepet Jade is single and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, he prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Joepet Jade has been engaged in his business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Joepet Jade joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joepet Jade has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC.  He is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to cook food for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Joepet Jade from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

Now requesting his first loan for 13000 PHP to repair his vehicle and purchase new tires for better service, he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.name: Mout

texts.en: Mout, aged 41, is a married woman who lives in Siem Reap Province. She earns her daily income by working as a local farmer in the village as well as selling a few goods in front of her house. She is married to Mmork, aged 35, who shares responsibility for earning income with Mout by driving a motorcycle taxi. He runs his business very well because he has communication skills which he uses with his customers. However, his income is not very much due to his motorcycle being too small to carry many passengers. That is why Mout has decided to ask for a loan of $1100 to buy a new motorcycle (tuk tuk) so that her husband can use it to pick up more passengers than before. She will use part of her loan funds to buy more items to sell. The couple has two children, both are single and live with them.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle (tuk tuk) for her husband and to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife, from the village of Sebasi Clarin Misamis Occidental, is 38 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns and operates a business selling barbeque in the local community. Engaged in her enterprise for over five years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marife joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC, she is requesting her eighth loan of 10000 PHP to purchase bananas and meat and other ingredients for her business. Marife plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Ret

texts.en: Ret, aged 29, is a humble villager living in the province of Siem Reap. She is married and blessed with four school-aged children, while her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. She is a homemaker and does many routine duties such as cooking delicious meals, caring for her children, cleaning the house, and managing the property in and around her house. Ret wishes to purchase a few fish to sell in the busy market to earn additional income and also to help support her husband with daily expenses. That is the reason why Ret is seeking a Kiva loan through HKL.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Preab

texts.en: The man shown in the picture is Preab, aged 61, who is a fisherman. He usually needs to take eight hours each day to fish in and around Tunle Sap River. He catches around 10 kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers who are retail sellers in the market. His wife’s name is Sab; she is 47 and works with him in the fishing business. The couple is blessed with five children, one of whom works in the local restaurant as assistant chef. Preab will use his loan to purchase a new machine to connect with his old boat and nets so that he can catch more fish.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine to connect to his old boat and nets so that he can catch more fish.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun, 59, is a rice farmer who also raise pigs at home. Married since 1979 to a teacher, she and her husband have three married children - two sons and one daughter. Both sons live in separate homes, while their daughter still lives in the family home and works as a garment factory worker.

Saroeun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for her daughter to drive to work as well as additional pigs and pig feed.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs to raise, pig feed, and a new motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un, a 46-year-old widowed tailor, lives in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has two daughters, one a garment factory worker and the other a teacher.  Un is requesting her first loan of $1,200  to complete the building of her new house.

loans.use: to finish building her house.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea, a local farmer, is a low-income person in Siem Reap Province where he plants crops on his own farm. He has five years' experience in the farming business. Besides this, he often burns firewood in a coal oven to produce charcoal for selling. From these occupations, he can make an average of US$5 a day which is used to pay expenses. His wife assists him in the same business and they currently live with six single children. Because of deficient money, Chea is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase seed potatoes for planting as it is the good season, the rainy season, for all kinds of crops to be planted.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes for planting.

Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more canned goods and snacks to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: San

texts.en: The old woman in the photograph is San, aged 60, who lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. San is a widow as her husband died of illness four years ago and now she lives with five children; four of them have already married and the remaining one is single and works as a worker in Rattanakiri Province. San owns a few farms that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops. San has another farm that she owns, but she has not yet planted crops on it. She hopes to use her Kiva loan to purchase peanut seed, insecticides, fertilizer for growing and to pay for plowing costs which she has hired before.

loans.use: to purchase peanut seed, insecticides, fertilizer and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Batzul

texts.en:
Batzul is 29 years old and lives with his wife and three children, ages 2 to 11, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, in his workplace’s yard. His oldest son is 11 years old and goes to primary school, while his wife, Uyanga, stays at home with their younger two children. 

Batzul worked as a woodworker at a local timber company from 2006 to 2010. He supports his family by operating his carpentry business. He started his business in 2010. Now he usually makes a ger (a Mongolian housing tent) to sell to a retailer. In the past year, he has established a continuous supply. 

Batzul is an honest and hardworking person. He plans to make a big, carved ger and then he wants to exhibit this ger. He is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more wood to make a big and carved ger.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to make a big and carved ger (Mongolian tent).

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
