This will be the third loan taken out by Esterlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to pay for the labor cost for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is from Pantaon, Ozamiz City. She is 58 years old. Crisanta is married and has three adult children. 

To make a living, Crisanta plants and harvests bananas for sale. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Crisanta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Crisanta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to purchase additional seedlings. This will be the third loan taken out by Crisanta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to purchase additional seedlings.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is from Garang Tangub City. She is 21 years old. Edna is single. 

To make a living, Edna raises fish for sale. Edna has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fishing nets. This will be the second loan taken out by Edna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Lodgenia

texts.en:
Lodgenia P. is 53 years old and widowed with four adult children. She is from the village of Malibangcao Clarin Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Lodgenia owns and operates a tailoring business. Her main source of income comes from providing women's tailoring services to local community members. Lodgenia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. 

Lodgenia joined GDMPC in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lodgenia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional fabric and materials. This will be the third loan taken out by Lodgenia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and materials

loans.name: Tulkinoi's Group

texts.en:
Tulkinoi is 37 years old and married. Her husband works in construction. The couple has two sons and a daughter, all of whom are at school Tulkinoi’s husband earns a monthly salary of 5,000 KGS. In order to earn additional money to provide for her family’s needs, Tulkinoi sells confections and works with a company who provides her with inventory. She earns 5,000 KGS a month.

Tulkinoi is the leader of this group of borrowers. She will use her portion of this loan to purchase additional cakes to sell as well as to purchase fertilizer for cultivating cotton. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cakes to sell and to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is 32 years old and married with five school-aged children. She is from the city of Maquilao Tangub City. To make a living, Rovelyn owns and operates a service-based business. Her main source of income comes from providing barbershop services in the local community. Rovelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

Rovelyn joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rovelyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase hairdo accessories and materials she needs to provide better service. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Rovelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and materials for her barbershop

loans.name: Otgon

texts.en:
Otgon is 65 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. Although she and her husband are retired, Otgon operates a food business. Each day, she prepares food in her home from eight in the morning until noon and then sells it at Mongolia’s largest outdoor firewood market, called Tsaiz, in the afternoon. Otgon started her business in 2008. After years of operation she has established a loyal customer following due to her delicious and quality meals. 

Otgon is requesting a loan of 300,000 MNT to purchase ingredients such as flour, and to hire others to prepare the food. She would like to expand her business and increase her working capital. In the future, Otgon hopes to have her own cafe.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 30 years old and single. She is from the village of Mialen Clarin Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Ivy owns and operates a general store. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ivy has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

Ivy joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as rice and corn grits to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Ivy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve her general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products such as rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Malikahon's Group

texts.en:
Malikahon is the leader of this group. She is 63 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised a son who is married and has two children. The son works in construction; he earns 5000 soms per month. 

Malikahon is engaged in livestock breeding, and at the moment she has three sheep and two cows. She also sells milk products, and in this way she makes an additional 3000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase two sheep in order to expand her flock, In the future Malikahon dreams of building a new house for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is 40 years old, married with five children. Two of them work while the others are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her eldest son works in a government organization while the 2nd one makes iron brushes. Her husband also makes iron brushes and is a blacksmith by trade. The iron brushes are used to remove dust particles and dirt spots.  

Rani is a caring lady who stays at home and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy iron to be able to make a larger quantity of brushes to sell and increase his profits. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating for almost 10 years. Rani is very much hopeful that this investment will be a profitable one for him. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady slightly raising her hand is Rani.

loans.use: To buy iron for making iron brushes to sell.

loans.name: Oktiabr

texts.en:
Mr. Oktiabr is 31 years old and a chef. He lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Oktiabr doesn’t own any land and his family live on his parents' property. Until the end of 2010, Oktiabr had worked as a chef at a restaurant for many years and he is an experienced chef.

 In January 2011 he decided to open his own cafeteria and at the moment he is renting a small cafeteria and runs it together with his wife. Oktiabr makes the dishes and his wife works as a waitress. The cafeteria is located in quite a crowded area and always full of customers. Recently Oktiabr built a greenhouse in his garden and he is planning to grow vegetables there. Nowadays food safety, especially vegetables are a big issue. Therefore Oktiabr is planning to grow his own organic vegetables and to use them in his cafeteria. He thinks it will save some costs and will attract more customers. The loan he is taking will be used to buy some good quality seeds and to process the land.

loans.use: To buy some good quality seeds to grow organic vegetables and to process the land.

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is 55 years old and has given birth to two sons. Both of them work. The elder one is an embroidery expert while the younger works in a hostel. Her husband operates a construction supplies business. He supplies construction supplies to different construction companies and people looking to build homes. 

Surriya is very supportive by nature. In order to financially support her family, she works in people's homes. She is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her son’s embroidery business. With the loan, he will purchase embroidery material in bulk to be able to provide better quality services to his customers and increase his profits. 

Surriya is expecting that after the loan investment, her son’s business will improve which will help her family to live a better financial life. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Surriya.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en: Ren earns about US$3 per day working in the port. She is a fish domestic laborer in the province of Siem Reap. She has a life partner, her husband, who works as a porter and earns an average of US$4 each day to help support Ren with the family expenses. They are blessed with eight children, five are single, the remaining three are married and live in separate houses. Two of their children are employed as a ferry boat deliverer and a porter. Recently, the family met a problem as the walls of their house were broken down in most parts. So Ren has sought a loan to purchase some wooden poles to rebuild her broken walls.

loans.use: to purchase wooden poles to rebuild her broken walls.

loans.name: Limpopo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 64-year-old Christine (holding the yellow folder) from Masvingo. She is married with no children.  Christine runs a retail business selling clothing and is also a preschool teacher. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenges her business faces are competition and defaults from debtors. 

Christine has requested a loan of $300 to increase her stock of clothes such as t-shirts, blouses and warm clothing for the winter. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of her family. In the future Christine plans to operate an outlet.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes such as t-shirts, blouses and warm clothing for the winter

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Nergui is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They own a land plot with a small family house on it. Her two youngest children attend a secondary school and the eldest one works with his father at a construction company as a laborer. 

Nergui is an experienced shoemaker and she makes only traditional Mongolian national shoes. She learned the skill from her father, who was a teacher of traditional shoemaking for many years. She started her shoemaking business in 1996 and since then, she has made many thousands of shoes and she has her own trusted customer base. 

During these years she has used one of her rooms at home as a workshop. But now her children are growing and need more space. The loan she is taking will be used to buy building materials and to build a separate room that will be used for her shoemaking business.

loans.use: To buy materials and build a room for her traditional Mongolian shoe making business.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is made up of only four borrowers, who are shown in the photo. The group leader, Rin, is 41 years old. He is a porter for people who come to buy something in the market, and he earns an average of US$3 profit per day. He is married with five children most of whom attend school, while his wife works in the port as a worker. Recently, the family's living conditions have not been comfortable because their house is broken, which is not comfortable to live in. Therefore, Rin is requesting a loan to repair his house.

The other three borrowers are: 
Chheun, who is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle for the traveling needs of her whole family.
Chheun, who is seeking a loan to purchase nets for her fishing activity.  
Meng, who is requesting a loan to repair her broken house.

loans.use: to repair his house.

loans.name: Sabi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 42 year old Chidoni (holding the yellow folder) from Masvingo.  She is married with three children aged 16, 23 and 25. Of the three, one is currently attending school.  Her husband is a mechanic.  

Chidoni runs a retail cross boarder business selling clothing.  The business has been in operation for 4 years.  She says the main challenges faced are competition and debtors not paying on time.  Chidoni has requested a loan of $400 to increase working capital which will enable her to buy more clothes such as blouses, t-shirts and blankets for the winter.  She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of her family.  In the future Chidoni plans to acquire a motor vehicle and build her own house.

loans.use: to increase working capital to buy more clothes such as blouses, t-shirts and blankets for the winter

loans.name: Soun

texts.en: From Siem Reap Province, Soun, 51, and her husband, 49, support their family by fishing with fishing implements along the Tunle Sap River which is the best place for fishing. They use many kinds of fishing tools to catch fresh fish. After the fishing, they take all the fish to the market; they can sell at a suitable price. As Soun’s house is located along the river, it is affected by flooding and also needs repair. She has requested her loan to buy supplies to repair the broken parts of her house. Soun has four single children, two of whom work in construction.

loans.use: to buy supplies to repair the broken parts of her house.

loans.name: Runde Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 36 year old Lucia (holding the yellow folder) from Masvingo.  She is married with two children aged 12 and 8.  Both children attend school.  Her husband is a businessman. 

Lucia runs a retail business selling clothing and spare parts.  The business has been in operation for 5 years.  She says the main challenges faced are competition.  Lucia has requested a loan of $300 to increase stock.  She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send her kids to better schools.  In the future Lucia plans to operate an outlet.

loans.use: to increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 30-year-old single mother of one.  

She works hard in her grocery store to provide for her four-year-old child.  

It's three years since she started the business. Esther joined Neema group in Faulu Kenya where she is able to share business ideas with the members, save her money and be guaranteed a loan by the members. 
 
Esther’s plan is to expand her business so as to get capital to open a wholesale grocery in the future. She has requested 20,000 KES to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 33-year-old married lady with two children, aged 12 and 22.  

She runs a cafe to earn a living. She has sustained her business for five years because of her good reputation. So far, she has employed two people in her business.  

She hopes to open more branches of her business so that she can employ more people. She needs 20,000 KES to buy ingredients such as cooking fat, tea leaves and salt.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as cooking fat, tea leaves and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents. After getting his university degree in pharmacy, he opened his own pharmacy in 2008, seeing a need for such services in the region. He's very happy with his business because he's able to help customers improve their health situation. He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. 

He obtained his first Kiva loan and has been an excellent client with punctual repayments. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to redecorate his pharmacy and add more space into it. In the future, he expects additional growth in his business.

loans.use: to redecorate his pharmacy.

loans.name: Zultsetseg

texts.en:
Zultsetseg is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children, aged 9 and 12, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house in the outer ger (traditional Mongolian housing tent) districts. 

She sells hats at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. Her husband works as a driver and also in the used clothing wholesale aftermarket. 
 
Usually, it is very difficult to obtain a rental contract with Narantuul because the stalls are in such high demand. When Zultsetseg first began her business, she rented a stall at Narantuul from another person who had a rental contract with Narantuul. This was an unstable business situation for her because the middleman could dismiss her at any time. 

In 2003, however, Zultsetseg had the opportunity to sign a rental contract directly with Narantuul in order to make her business more stable. Now her working capital is almost 4 million MNT, and she sells hats. 

For the past 11 years, Zultsetseg and her husband have been successfully improving their living conditions gradually. For example, they bought a used microbus with 3,500,000 MN of their business earnings in 2005.

With this loan of 1,300,000 MNT, Zultsetseg will purchase more hats from Ereen City, China. Zultsetseg wants to use this loan to help support her in this very busy shopping season of the year.

loans.use: to purchase more hats to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Mango Group

texts.en:
Somoe, who is in her mid-30s, is single with 2 children. She is also taking care of her sister's daughter who has just finished her primary seven. Samoe has been selling cooked food, fruits, and vegetables for 3 years now. She works from 7:00 am to 11:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. Her dream is to one day build a house of her own.

This will be Samoe's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her food stock, and purchase more fruits and vegetables and has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase "genge" (Kiswahili fruits and vegetables). 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mango" which has a total of 17 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase fruit and vegetable stocks to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, a 32-year-old, lives with his wife and their 5-year-old child who goes to school. Paul started his business by selling little goods such as sweets, pens and handkerchiefs. Four years ago, he was able to raise enough money and he opened a retail shop and added stock. Thanks to Faulu Kenya for financially supporting him.

Paul hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future. He has requested a 60,000 KES loan to buy sugar, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Dilfuzahon's Group

texts.en:
Dilfuzahon is the leader of this group. She is 42 and married to a cook. Her husband works in Kazakhstan, so Dilfuzahon takes care of two sons by herself. The first son works in construction and earns 3,000 KGS per month. The second son studies at school. 

In order to contribute money to the family budget, Dilfuzahon cultivates cotton and breeds livestock animals. In this way she earns an additional 5,000 KGS per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more sheep for breeding. She hopes that the loan will help her to expand the business. With money gained from reselling livestock, she wants to finish a house construction.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Batnyam

texts.en:
Mr. Batnyam is 40 years old, lives with his wife and three daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His elder two daughters attend a secondary school and the youngest one goes to kindergarten. His family lives in a one-bedroom flat which he bought recently. 

Batnyam has been running a clothes retail business at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in the city, since 2003. Batnyam’s wife Myagmarsuren works with her husband  at the market as a salesperson. They sell dresses and casual outerwear which they buy from wholesalers who imports the clothing from China. Even though the market is located outdoors, they work there all year around because the rent is cheaper than for indoor space. 

Batnyam is planning to increase his inventory by buying more clothes for the summer season. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more summer clothes to sell, increasing his working capital and profit.

loans.use: To buy more summer clothes to sell.

loans.name: Edmund0

texts.en:
Edmundo is 43 years old and married with two school-aged children. He earns about Php 30,000 per crop season as a farmer working in the Philippines.

Edmundo grows corn and has been doing that for 30 years. Edmundo is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow.

In the future, Edmundo hopes that his farming business will improve to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy large amounts of corn to sell and some onions

loans.name: Dilrabohon's Group

texts.en:
Dilrabohon is the leader of this group. She is 32 and married to a builder; his monthly salary is 3000 soms. Together they are bringing up a son, who is preschool age and goes to a kindergarten. The family owns 0.5 hectares of land and they use it to cultivate cotton.  Selling the cotton on the market Dilrabohon earns an additional 5000 soms per month. 

She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to purchase mineral fertilizers for cultivating cotton. In the future she plans to purchase cattle in order to resell them at a higher price after being fattened. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 62-year-old married lady and has four children.  For eleven years, she has been operating a retail shop to earn a living.  Besides that, she owns rental houses which generate additional income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business and has employed one person.

Her dream is to stabilize her business in the future for more income generation.  She has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to open another retail shop and buy sugar, salt, maize flour, soap and cooking fat.

loans.use: To open another retail shop and buy sugar, salt, maize flour, and soap and cooking fat.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 50 years old,she has 6 children who are ages 12-30 years old.  All are in school, apart from the youngest.  Her husband is a driver.  

She sells irish potatoes on a whole sale scale and she has done this business for 11 years.  This business has enabled her to educate her children and feed her family as well.  She needs a loan to buy more irish potatoes and make more profits.  With the profits she plans to buy food for her family and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: She plans to buy Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Veuve de 47 ans, Afi est mère d’un enfant. Elle est revendeuse de charbons de bois, et de céréales à Lomé depuis 1995.elle s’approvisionne à Agou une localité située dans la région des plateaux a 100 km de la capitale. Malgré la fatigue de cette activité elle travaille sans relâche pour subvenir aux besoins de son enfant à qui seule la charge lui revient.
texts.en: A widow, Afi is 47 years old and the mother of one child. She has been a retailer of charcoal and grains in Lomé, the capital of Togo, since 1995. She gets her supplies in Agou, a town located in the Plateaux Region and 100 km from the capital. Despite how exhausting this business is, she works tirelessly to meet the needs of her child, whom she supports entirely by herself.

loans.use: to buy corn and some grains

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao has been living in the Siem Reap Province from when she was young until the present time. She is a 47-year-old woman who sells one kind of Khmer cake. She always has many customers who come to buy her tasty cake. Usually Mao generates around $5 profit a day to meet the needs of her family. She is a single woman because she was divorced from her husband a few years ago. She has three children, one works in the construction field as a domestic construction worker, another is selling Khmer cake, and the other one is an office staff member for a private company. Mao has decided to ask for a loan of $1000 to buy a new motorbike for her child to commute to their workplace.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her child to commute to their workplace.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Aida has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional beverages, canned goods & snacks.

Aida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional beverages, canned goods & snacks

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married man and the father of two school-age children. He is from Lebanon. He opened a juice and cocktail shop in 1986. His freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of his town and its surroundings. Lebanon is known for its multiple seasons so there is always a variety of fruit during the year. He is the main income provider of the family.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business by purchasing additional merchandise and renovating his shop in order to attract more clients. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise and renovate his shop

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 46 years old and she is single.  She sells snacks made out of wheat flour products such as bread, chapaties, etc.  She has been doing this business for 7 years and the profits from this business have enabled her to pay her house rent and feed her family as well. 

She  is also able to set aside some savings in the hopes of expanding her business.  She hopes to use the loan for opening up another business.  She wants to begin selling cassava and vegetables in addition to the snacks she has been selling.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing food stuffs she has not been selling.

loans.name: Zambezi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 49 year old Jenipher (holding the yellow folder) from Masvingo.  She is widowed with four children.  

Jenipher runs a retail business selling clothing and footwear at the local flea market.  The business has been in operation for 10 years and she employs two people.  She says the main challenge she faces is limited capital.  Jenipher has requested a loan of $300 to increase her stock of clothes.  She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's quality of life as there will be more disposable income.  In the future Jenipher plans to grow her business into a shop.

loans.use: to increase stock of clothes

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Ivy has a retail shop that sells canned goods, eggs, biscuits & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & biscuits.

Ivy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ivy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & biscuits

loans.name: Batochir

texts.en:
Mr.Batochir is a 43 year old truck driver.  He lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He owns a small land plot and the family house on it.  His only son Ankhbayar, age 19, who is a student at the National Science and Technology University. 

Until 2009 Batochir used to run a small grocery shop nearby his home but had to give it up due to the increase of rent price. Then in 2009 he bought a truck using his savings and started running a building material delivery business.  Each year Batochir plans and completes some small building project. Within last two years he built two garages in his backyard.  This time Batochir is planning to extend his house, making a separate room for his son.  The loan he is taking will be used to buy the necessary building materials to extend his house making separate room for his son who is student.

loans.use: To buy the necessary building materials to extend his house making a separate room for his son who is student

loans.name: Rosalind

texts.en:
Rosalind is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rosalind has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages, eggs & biscuits. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Rosalind has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalind hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Mariya's Group

texts.en:
Mariya is the treasurer of this group. She is 27 and divorced. She also has a five year-old daughter who is in kindergarten. Four years ago, with the initial investment of 10000 soms, Mariya started selling second-hand clothes. Her business has been growing successfully and she earns 13000 soms per month.  Mariya will use the loan proceeds to purchase more clothes, which will increase her sales volume.  

In the future Mariya wants to improve the family’s living conditions and give a good education to her daughter.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for inventory

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with five children. 

Eva has a retail shop that sells beauty products, perfumes, t-shirts & blouses from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy additional stocks from NATASHA & AVON.

Eva is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Eva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Jean Batiste

texts.en: Jean Batiste is 30 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. His wife owns a shop where she sells different items. Jean Batiste sells food stuffs such as matooke (green bananas). This business has enabled him build his own house. He is requesting a loan to buy more matooke in order to increase his profits. He plans to buy animals with the profits he hopes to earn.

loans.use: To purchase matooke(green bananas) for sale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Cecilia has a retail shop that sells fish like mackerel & milkfish. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for PHP 3,000 to buy additional fish.

Cecilia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Cecilia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 28 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school. Rachel works with her husband. They have a bakery where they make bread. Rachel has been in this business for one year. Her business is going well. She is requesting a loan to buy more bread ingredients and stock them in order to make more bread and increase her profits. She plans to renovate  her house and pay fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread ingredients.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is 47 years old, married, and has three adult children. He earns about 20,000 PHP per harvesting season as a farmer working in the Philippines. Jimmy grows corn and has been doing so for three years. Jimmy is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow. In the future, Jimmy hopes that his farming business will improve to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Alecia

texts.en:
Alecia is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Alecia has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & biscuits.

Alecia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Alecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & biscuits

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Grace has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & fruit salad. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Grace is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Nimfa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, eggs, noodles & snacks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy eggs, snacks & canned goods.

Nimfa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nimfa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy eggs, snacks & canned goods

loans.name: Clemantine

texts.en: Clemantine is 41 years old with four children who are 5-15 years old. She is happily married to a businessman. Clemantine owns a general store in which she sells different items such as soap, juice, rice etc. She has done this business for three years. This business, together with her husband’s help, has enabled her to begin building a family house and pay for her children school fees. She is requesting a loan to buy more items and fill her store in order to make more profits. With the profits, she plans to continue building her family house.

loans.use: To buy items such as soap, juice etc

loans.name: Agbei

texts.fr: Revendeuse et distributrice d’ignames,de mais,et de céréales à Lomé depuis 2006, Agbeî est mariée à un chauffeur et maman d’un enfant. Elle a 41 ans et ne ménage aucun effort pour voir grandir son enfant dans de meilleures  conditions. Elle s’approvisionne à SOKODE une ville de la région centrale située au centre du pays à 355 km au nord de LOME. Elle est à son quatrième prêt dans notre institution.
texts.en: A retailer and distributor of yams, corn, and grains in Lomé since 2006, Agbeî is married to a driver and the mother of one child.  She is 41 years old and does whatever it takes to see that her child grows up under the best of conditions. Agbeî purchases her supplies in SOKODE, a city in the Centrale Region, located in the middle of the country and about 355 km to the north of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is on her fourth loan with our institution.

loans.use: to buy yams and corn

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Robert has a barber shop that provides services like hair cuts. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of  PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed to maintain the service.

Robert is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future ,Robert hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy new scissor, alcohol, powder and more to be used in the service

loans.name: Elina

texts.en: Elina is 43 years old and single. She sells timber furniture such as chairs, cupboards, etc. She has doing so for seven years and her business is going  well. Elina is requesting a loan to buy more timber to make more furniture and increase her profits. She has bought a piece of land on which she hopes to build a family house in the future. She plans to pay her house rent with the profits she plans to make.

loans.use: to purchase timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables, spices & bananas

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 37 years old, single, and has one child. She owns a supermarket in which she sells different items such as juices, fruits, biscuits, etc. She has been in this business for three years. Jacqueline’s business has enabled her build her own house. She is requesting a loan to buy more items for her supermarket so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as juices, fruits, chewing gums, etc. for her supermarket.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Elma has a shop that sells banana & sweet potato cue. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients like ripe bananas, sugar & oil.

Elma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like ripe bananas, sugar & oil

loans.name: Kofi

texts.fr: Père  d’un enfant, Kofi vit avec sa femme qui est revendeuse. Agé de 38 ans, il est chauffeur depuis 2007 et parallèlement fait de la peinture et tôlerie. Ce prêt qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter quelques accessoires de travail pour satisfaire  dans les meilleures conditions  sa clientèle il tient à son rôle de chef de famille et ne lésine pas sur les moyens pour satisfaire les besoins de sa maisonnée. Toute son activité d’achat et d’approvisionnement se déroule à Lomé.
texts.en: A father of one child, Kofi lives with his wife, who is a retailer. He is 38 years old and has been a driver since 2007. Concurrently, he does painting and sheet metal work. This loan he is requesting will enable him to buy a few work accessories in order to satisfy his customers with the best. He cares about his role as the head of household and spares no expense when it comes to meeting the needs at home. The purchasing and supplying for this business all occur in Lomé, the capital of Togo.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and paint

loans.name: Jeaninne

texts.en: Jeaninne is married and has one child. Her husband is a hard working businessman. Jeaninne sells meat and she has been doing so for three years.  Her business has helped her meet her needs and earn some savings. She is requesting a loan to buy more meat for sale so that she can increase her profits. She plans to save all her profits and buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to puchase meat for sale.

loans.name: Bironke

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans, Bironke est une dame mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est revendeuse  et distributrice de Bijoux à Lomé depuis 06 ans. Pour les besoins de son commerce elle voyage sur Accra(GHANA) pour faire ses achats. Elle est à son troisième cycle de prêt et maîtrise bien son activité.
texts.en: Bironke, 48, is a married lady and mother of one child. She has been selling and distributing costume jewelry in  Lomé for six years. For the needs of her business, she travels to Accra (Ghana) to do her buying. She is on her third loan and is very well-versed in her activity.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Merlinda has a shop that sells t-shirts, blouses & beauty products. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stock from NATASHA, MSE & AVON.

Merlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Merlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA, MSE & AVON

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 42 years old, widowed, and has four children, all of whom attend school. Olive sells Irish potatoes and she has been doing so for  11 years. This business has enabled her to pay school fees for her children. She is requesting a loan to buy more Irish potatoes and hence earn more profits. With the profits she plans to buy a cow.

loans.use: to purchase Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Ainakan's Group

texts.en:
Ainakan is the leader of this group. She is 47 and married to a coordinating manager. Together with her husband she has raised a daughter and a son, and both children are employed. Ten years ago with the initial investment of 35000 soms Ainakan purchased a pavilion and began to provide hairdressing services. At the moment her monthly profit is 7400 soms. Ainakan applied for the loan because she needs some additional funds to purchase foodstuffs, beverages, meat and other items for celebrating her grandchild’s birth. In the future she wants to save money for purchasing a big house for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to assist with building their businesses; also, to purchase foodstuffs, beverages, meat and other items for a celebration.

loans.name: Joselina

texts.en:
Joselina is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Joselina has a retail shop that sells rice & cheese cakes. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients like sugar, flour & eggs.

Joselina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Joselina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like sugar, flour & eggs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Myrna has a retail shop that sells rice & cheese cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients like sugar, flour & eggs.

Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like sugar, flour & eggs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old single woman living with her parents and two siblings. She has almost five years of experience selling beauty products to local customers. She also provides her clients with beauty and hairdressing services. She works on a freelance basis. In parallel, she has been working for a local company since 2007. It’s very common in Lebanon to have multiple jobs in order to be able to handle the high costs of living. She has taken advantage of her first Kiva loan and has been a reliable client paying on time. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more beauty products and new hairdressing tools and supplies. In the future, she is willing to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products and hairdressing tools and supplies

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is 48 years old, and she has 5 children who are ages 7 to 21 years old. Her husband is a driver. Therese owns a bar in which she sells different kinds of beer. She has been selling this beer for 8 years and it has enabled her meet her family needs and educate her children. She needs a loan to buy more beer and reinvest in her business. Therese plans to reinvest the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: buy beer to sell at her bar and reinvest in her business.

loans.name: Dork

texts.en:
Mr.Dork has been working as a foreman construction worker since the beginning of 2010.  From his work, he is able to make around $5 income a day to use for the whole family expense.  With the cash, he uses it to pay for food expense, education expense, utility expense and other necessary expenses. 

To supplement this income, his wife plants rice crops and vegetable crop on her farmland following the season. Mr. Dork wishes to buy a new motorbike but he doesn’t have immediate money to buy one. So, Mr. Dork would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle to use to commute to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old Lebanese married man. He is living with his wife and two school-age children. He has owned a barber shop since 2008. He is well known in the whole region for his good business reputation and great customer service. In parallel, during the school year, he works as a driver transporting students from their houses to school and vice versa. He works hard in both jobs to be able to cover the heavy life expenses.  Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added products needed for his barber shop. He will also purchase a wax machine in order to satisfy his customer’s demands.  In the future, he is planning to expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies and a wax machine

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 43 years old, and she has a 13-year-old child in school. She is single and hardworking. Joyce sells snacks, which include donuts, and she also sells bread. This business has enabled her pay school fees for her child. She is requesting a loan to buy more bread and donuts and to make more sales and savings. She plans to use her savings for buying equipment which will help her in her business.

loans.use: to purchase bread and donuts to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the construction of a dairy unit

loans.name: Tumurtulga

texts.en:
Mr. Tumurtulga is 57 years old and a  driving instructor. He has been working as a driving instructor for 39 years and he still works as an instructor. He lives with his wife and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He owns a plot of land and a family house on it. He has 2 other children who are grown up, both University graduates who live separately with their families. To give them proper education Tumurtulga spent all his savings and income while they were a students until 2009. 

Since then, he has gradually improved his family’s living conditions. Two years ago Tumurtulga bought a family car, and last year he did some light improvements to his house. This time he is planning to do proper restoration to his family house by making the walls thicker and the house warmer to withstand Mongolian harsh winters. To do that he needs to buy rockwool insulation materials and to put them under floor, in all the walls and the roof, plus replace the doors and windows with double-glazed ones. Finally, the house will become warm and more efficient in the use of charcoal (for heat) as well as greener.

loans.use: buy insulation for all walls and the roof, plus replace the doors and windows to make the house warmer and greener.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a motorcycle for getting into the transportation business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard has been a farmer in Litein in South Rift Kenya for the last 30 years, employing 4 farmhands and producing tea and milk for the local market. He gets additional income from his building blocks sales.

Richard has requested for a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the income from dairy will help in educating his children, who are numbering 8 and all in school. He remains optimistic that his business will continue to grow.

Richard, however, mentions droughts and poor markets as the business challenges for the local farmers.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Seb

texts.en:
Mrs. Seb is 44 and the mother of four single children, one of whom is employed in Thailand.  She and her husband are local farmers who have been planting a variety of crops for over ten years. 

They are able to generate a daily income of approximately of US$ 6 to cover with their expenses.  Recently, he has needed some money to start planting rice crops, but their current savings was not enough to make it possible.  In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Seb requested a loan of $500 to pay for the cost of farmland which she bought before hand and to buy many sacks of fertilizes for her crop to grow well.

loans.use: to pay for farmland which she bought on credit and also to buy many sacks of fertilizes for her crop.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is 30 years old and married with 1 school-aged child. He earns about Php 10,000 per cropping season as a farmer working in the Philippines.

Carlos grows corn and has been doing it for 3 years. Carlos is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow.

In the future, Carlos hopes that his farming business will improve to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn, age 36, is a resident of Kompong Cham Province.  She is a vendor who sells produce in the busy local market.  She sells a few kinds of vegetables and earns an average of $1.60 a day.  She is married to Mr. Van, 34, who is a construction worker, and they have been married for many years, but they still do not have a baby. 

Horn will be using the loan to buy a used motorbike to transport her vegetables to the market to sell so she won’t pay cash for a motor taxi. This can help her to decrease traveling expense.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike to transport her vegetables to the market for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is 36 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. He earns about Php 30,000 per cropping season as a farmer working in the Philippines.

Domingo grows corn and has been doing it for 15 years. Domingo is asking for a loan of Php 25,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow.

In the future, Domingo hopes that his farming business will improve to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Sehouegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEHOUEGNON est composé de trois personnes qui vivent tous dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Hélène Baï est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Hélène Baï est née le 18 Août 1972 dans une ville du Bénin. Hélène Baï est mariée à un brodeur nommé Franck et a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant à sa charge. Hélène Baï et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Depuis près de douze ans, Hélène Baï vit ensemble avec son mari dans une ville du Bénin. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie, Hélène Baï exerce depuis huit ans environs comme activité la vente de divers condiments de sauce (tomate, oignons, piments, etc.) et de façon secondaires, la vente de conserves dans son quartier. Hélène Baï achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Hélène Baï sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEHOUEGNON, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
The SEHOUEGNON group is composed of three persons who all live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. This is the fifth time that this group has asked  ALIDé for financial aid to boost their businesses. The representative of the group, Hélène Baï, is the one who is raising her hand in the photo. 

Hélène Baï was born on August 18, 1972 in a town in Bénin. She is married to an embroidery specialist named Franck and she has two children, both enrolled in school and living with her. The two parents support their family together. 

For almost 12 years, Hélène Baï has been living with her husband in a town in Bénin. Before she began supporting herself and improving her living conditions, Hélène worked for eight years selling various condiments for sauces (tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc.) Secondarily, she sold canned goods in her neighborhood. She buys her products in Bénin. 

Seeking to satisfy her clientele and increase her earnings, Hélène Baï is requesting, together with the other members of her group SEHOUEGNON, another loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments for use in sauces as well as canned goods.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
The crop planting business is the main part of 37-year-old Mrs. Eng's daily duty at the garment industry.  Eng has had experience in the agriculture sector since 2000 and is making an income averaging $1.50 each day to use for the family’s needs. 

She has a life partner in her husband who is working in the construction field.  The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their four kids.  Most of their kids are attending school.  She wants to buy a machine for cutting wood and she will use this machine to serve all the people who need to cut big wooden planks.  With this loan, she will increase her daily income.  This is the season why Mrs. Eng is applying for the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy a machine for cutting wood .

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a resident of Kitale town in Western Kenya and has been in active farming for 13 years. She is married with 8 children, all adults. Her farm produces milk, eggs, and vegetables, all sold to the local market.

Esther has made a fourth loan request amounting to 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry birds. She says more birds will give more eggs for family consumption as well as additional income from the business.

Esther says the poultry business faces challenges of diseases, which are very rampant.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry birds.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a widow, age 32, with 2 children, both attending school. She has been in farming for 3 years producing milk, maize and vegetables for the local market. She has one farmhand on her farm.

Roseline has made a second loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy income will improve her family livelihood. She is optimistic the business will continue to grow.

She mentions animals feed shortages during dry seasons and diseases as the challenges to business.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more poultry birds

loans.name: Mahougnon-Agla Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON-AGLA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Eve (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 12 Septembre 1975 dans une ville du Bénin. Eve est mariée à un plombier nommé Gilbert. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés dont deux sont à leur charge. Eve vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Eve a très peu fréquenté l'école. Depuis environs huit ans, Eve vend divers produits ménagers (bassines, articles en plastiques, marmites, etc.) dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Eve vend de la farine de manioc accompagné de galettes d'arachide dans son quartier. Eve s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Eve et les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON-AGLA sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
MAHOUGNON-AGLA is a group of three persons all of whom reside in the same neighborhood in Bénin. The representative of the group, Eve (who is raising her hand in the photo) was born on September 12, 1975 in a town in Bénin. 

Eve is married to a plumber by the name of Gilbert. The couple have three children, all enrolled in school; two are living under their roof. Eve lives with her husband and children. The couple share in supporting their family. 

Eve went to school only briefly. For about eight years, she has been selling various household goods (basins, plastic goods, pots, etc.) in her neighborhood. Secondarily, she sells manioc flour and peanut cakes in her neighborhood. She buys her supplies in a town in Bénin. 

This is the first time that Eve and the other members of the MAHOUGNON-AGLA group are asking for financial support from ALIDé, seeking to bolster their working capital and grow their businesses and better respond to the needs of their clientele.

loans.use: to buy basins, plastic ware, aluminum pots, and manioc flour.

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon is a hardworking man. He is married and has 3 children. For 20 years he has been running his cafe. Naimjon has his own national cafe called "Chaikhana."  In his cafe he cooks different tasty foods. In 2002 he had a small cafe but today he has increased size. He is going to receive the second loan from Imon International. For this purpose Naimjon has requested a loan of 3,000 $ USD for expansion of his business. From the profit which he hopes to make he would like to provide better living conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to expand his business and increase working capital.

loans.name: Demandovo Ste Rita Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DEMANDOVO STE RITA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone géographique au Bénin. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Victoire Ablawa est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Victoire Ablawa est née en septembre 1964 dans une ville du Bénin. Victoire Ablawa a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à sa charge. Victoire Ablawa a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis quatre ans, afin de subvenir à ses besoins et de mieux assurer les différentes charges de ses enfants, Victoire Ablawa prépare de la nourriture (riz mélangé avec du haricot, du pain), qu'elle vend dans son quartier. Parallèlement, Victoire Ablawa vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques, ce qui lui permet d'avoir plusieurs sources de revenus. Victoire Ablawa s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Victoire Ablawa sollicite un autre crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DEMANDOVO STE RITA.
texts.en:
The DEMANDOVO STE RITA group consists of three people who live in the same geographic area in Benin. This is the group’s fourth time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. 

Victoire Ablawa, the group’s representative, has her hand raised in the photo. She was born in a city of Benin in September 1964. Victoire has three children, all of whom have received formal schooling. Two of the children are still in her care. Victoire herself quit school at the secondary level. 

For the past four years, Victoire has been preparing and selling food (a dish of rice & bean, some bread) around her neighborhood in order to support herself and provide for her children. She also sells mobile phone recharge cards as an additional source of income. She gets her supplies in a city of Benin. 

In an effort to meet the needs of her customers and increase her revenue, Victoire is seeking this new loan together with the other members of the DEMANDOVO STE RITA group.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, vegetable oil, and sauce condiments

loans.name: Makhsuda

texts.en:
Makhsuda is a hardworking woman who is married. Her husband works in Russia. For 10 years Makhsuda has been running her cattle-feeding and farming business. She cultivates potatoes, carrots, Lucerne and corn. Also Makhsuda engaged in gardening. From the profit which she hopes to make she plans to marry off her grandson. Her son, daughter and daughter-in-law help her in this business. Makhsuda would like to get a loan of 13,000 TJS for purchasing of cattle and expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy oranges and guava to produce fresh juice

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en:
Farrukh farms and he has a car. In free time he engages in the service of providing a taxi. He is married and has four children. He mainly deals with cultivation of wheat, grapes and seedlings. Several times he received a loan from Imon International and he likes our services. He wants to continue cooperating with Imon International. Farrukh would like to get a loan of 5,000 TJS for purchasing of mineral fertilizers and payment of workers. Farrukh wishes to expand his business and hopes that the lenders will support him.

loans.name: Uchkun

texts.en:
Uchkun is a hardworking man. He is married and he has five children. Uchkun has a high education and he works at school as a teacher of physical culture. Besides this he has an additional income. He cultivates potatoes and wheat. This business helps him care for his wife and children. Uchkun would like to get a loan of 4,000 TJS for purchasing of mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants, in order to get a good harvest and expand his business.  He liked Imon International because he thinks that our service is affordable and convenient for him.

loans.name: Nematjon

texts.en:
Nematjon is a hard-working man. He is married and has four children. Nematjon has engaged in animal husbandry and cultivating of wheat. His mother and sons help him in his business. He works hard in order to provide his family’s needs. Nematjon wishes to increase the number of his cattle and expand his business. He has requested a loan of 10,000 TJS for purchasing of cattle. Nemajon is thankful to lenders who will support him.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living on his own. In 2007, this man decided to start his own business selling coffee using a speciA. carrier. He travels across different areas and villages to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additionA. products needed. He’s planning to expand his business in order to earn a greater income. In the future, he is hoping to open his own coffee shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He has owned a small grocery store since 2009. He sells all types of food products, juices, soft drinks, breads etc. His shop is situated in a busy area so there are a good number of customers passing by. He helps his father with the household expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 US from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his store’s inventory. He expects that his business will continue to grow with the coming years.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and four siblings. She has been working in the agricultural field since 2008. She grows a wide variety of vegetables using large plastic tents. These tents allow her to grow more types of products throughout the year. She is well established in her business and has a wide range of tools and equipment to help with her work. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. for the purchase and installation of a plastic tent. She estimates that with the coming harvest, her profits will be increased.

loans.use: to purchase new plastic tent

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children.  He has made his living as a professional driver, operating a van service for students in his village as well as neighboring towns, for over 25 years. In addition, he offers transportation services for customers upon their request. 

He cooperates with his wife who works as a teacher in a local school to be able to afford the high cost of living. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 US from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform much needed maintenance on his van, including changing the tires and repairing the engine. In the future, he is planning to purchase a new van and hire a part timer employee to work on it.

loans.use: to perform much needed maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single Lebanese man. He is living with his parents and two siblings. Despite his young age, he has been working as a mechanic since 2009. His work consists of performing maintenance on all types of cars.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 US from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a car in order to be able to satisfy his customer's demands by serving them whenever their cars are damaged. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock
